<div class="c-pageProductReviews_row g-outer-spacing-bottom-xxlarge"><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 10 out of 10" aria-label="User score 10 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_green c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-gray90 c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">10</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/undercatt/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="undercatt">
    undercatt
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Sep 27, 2024
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>I have never played a game this good. This was the first souls game I played, and this has successfully made me fall in love with the genre. I cannot make any comments on the graphics because I was playing on a lower-end television, but I can comment on the boss design. Most of the bosses are incredible. Just incredibly well made fights, with the exception of a few, like Regal Ancestral Spirit. RAS was just simply not made for melee, which is the play style I always take up. I haven't ever completely a magic-only run, but from what I have heard magic is extremely fun to play. I just simply prefer the difficulty that comes with melee. Melee combat feels really, really good, although it does not flow as well as Sekiro: Shadows Die Twice. The majority of the weapons in the game are extremely well made and have some purpose. Bows and crossbows are pretty much entirely pointless, though. I have pretty much no complaints with the game, other than it not being cross-platform. I think if the game was cross-platform I'd only enjoy it more. I suppose the game could also benefit from Seamless Co-op being a vanilla feature, but other than that the game is flawless.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

      Xbox Series X
    </div></div></div> <!----> <!----></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 10 out of 10" aria-label="User score 10 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_green c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-gray90 c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">10</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/Soyanna/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="Soyanna">
    Soyanna
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Sep 4, 2024
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>I’m wary of giving anything a 10, but considering I’d give it a 9.5 or 9.6, I think it’s fair to round up.

Anyways, I haven’t touched a souls game in the past; this was my first. I was worried about the approachability of the game, and if that’s concern you have, it’s a fair one. However,
I found myself loving the lack of hand-holding and level of challenge the game offers. It’s truly unlike any other open world game I’ve played—and I mean that in the best way.

You have a ridiculous amount of freedom to tackle the game in the way that you want to. If you’d like a bit of help, there is a plethora of resources available online. You can use as few or as many of them as you’d wish. To be clear, you do not, in any way, need to use said guides—just meant to say the option is there.

Even as a new player, I found myself consulting 3rd party guides sporadically at best. Maybe I’d be stuck on a boss. Or perhaps I wouldn’t quite understand damage scaling and its relation to particular stats. Even then, I took to the internet briefly, coming away with information that was helpful but, again, not absolutely necessary.

As a whole, the game respects you as a player. In a world where open world games tend to feel the need to mark every single point of interest on a mini map, fearful that you might miss something, Elden Ring goes in the opposite direction. You will miss things. But when the lands between is as packed with content and secrets as it is, you’ll probably find that missing things is worth it when the trade-off is an almost overwhelming sense of discovery. Stumbling upon a seemingly innocuous tunnel only to find out that it contains a sprawling dungeon never gets old.

If you’re worried about the reputation of the souls franchise and its unforgiving gameplay, don’t be. You’ll be fine. You won’t like the game if you despise any level of frustration in the games you play; however, if you like a challenge, you’re in for a treat.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">
        Read More
      </span> <!----> <!----></button></div> <!----></div></div> <div class="c-siteReview_extra u-grid u-grid-gap-medium g-inner-spacing-medium o-border-thin-top g-border-gray30 c-siteReview_extra-user"><!----> <div class="c-siteReview_externalLink g-color-gray80 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter c-siteReview_flag"><svg class="g-outer-spacing-right-small"><use xlink:href="#flag"></use></svg> <span class="g-text-link u-text-underline-under u-text-uppercase">Report</span></div> <!----> <div class="c-siteReview_platform g-text-bold g-color-gray80 g-text-xsmall u-text-right u-text-uppercase">
      Xbox Series X

  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Aug 18, 2024
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>One of the best games i've ever played. Truly masterpiece that combines excellency in his narrative with a very polished set of mechanics.</span></div> <!----> <!----></div></div> <div class="c-siteReview_extra u-grid u-grid-gap-medium g-inner-spacing-medium o-border-thin-top g-border-gray30 c-siteReview_extra-user"><!----> <div class="c-siteReview_externalLink g-color-gray80 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter c-siteReview_flag"><svg class="g-outer-spacing-right-small"><use xlink:href="#flag"></use></svg> <span class="g-text-link u-text-underline-under u-text-uppercase">Report</span></div> <!----> <div class="c-siteReview_platform g-text-bold g-color-gray80 g-text-xsmall u-text-right u-text-uppercase">
      Xbox Series X
    </div></div></div> <!----> <!----></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 8 out of 10" aria-label="User score 8 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_green c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-gray90 c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">8</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/Lidso/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="Lidso">
    Lidso
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Jul 9, 2024
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>This dark souls-like and open-world adventure continues to mock the player in symbolism and difficulty. The experience is rewarding with detailed, immersive, and atmospheric aesthetics while punishing with little guidance for direction and strategy. Navigation is scenic and relaxing, however, traversal is sometimes difficult and frustrating. A companion guide wiki may seem desired for completion and during moments of uncertainty. Multiplayer is flexible, aiming for a choice-driven interaction whether it is pvp or co-op. Overall, it is a great game with demanding skill requirements.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">
        Read More
      </span> <!----> <!----></button></div> <!----></div></div> <div class="c-siteReview_extra u-grid u-grid-gap-medium g-inner-spacing-medium o-border-thin-top g-border-gray30 c-siteReview_extra-user"><!----> <div class="c-siteReview_externalLink g-color-gray80 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter c-siteReview_flag"><svg class="g-outer-spacing-right-small"><use xlink:href="#flag"></use></svg> <span class="g-text-link u-text-underline-under u-text-uppercase">Report</span></div> <!----> <div class="c-siteReview_platform g-text-bold g-color-gray80 g-text-xsmall u-text-right u-text-uppercase">

  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>does it even have to be said? game is a ten , hard and worth it. sad i wrote this review so late</span></div> <!----> <!----></div></div> <div class="c-siteReview_extra u-grid u-grid-gap-medium g-inner-spacing-medium o-border-thin-top g-border-gray30 c-siteReview_extra-user"><!----> <div class="c-siteReview_externalLink g-color-gray80 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter c-siteReview_flag"><svg class="g-outer-spacing-right-small"><use xlink:href="#flag"></use></svg> <span class="g-text-link u-text-underline-under u-text-uppercase">Report</span></div> <!----> <div class="c-siteReview_platform g-text-bold g-color-gray80 g-text-xsmall u-text-right u-text-uppercase">
      Xbox Series X
    </div></div></div> <!----> <!----></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 4 out of 10" aria-label="User score 4 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_red c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-white c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">4</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/FelipeCalatza/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="FelipeCalatza">
    FelipeCalatza
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Jun 6, 2024
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>I enjoyed a lot of Sekiro's gameplay, Bloodborne's ambiance and story, and DS3's overall vibe as a game. I had Elden Ring on my wishlist for almost two years, and when I finally got it, I was **** combat in Elden Ring quickly becomes monotonous. Once you acquire a good weapon, which requires some initial effort, you tend to stick with it for the rest of the game. This is because there are only a few truly effective weapons, and upgrading a weapon is such an investment that farming materials to level up another one feels **** game features a wide variety of enemies, but unfortunately, about 70% of them share the same moveset and slow behavior, making them easy to defeat in 2-3 hits. The most interesting enemies are the faster and more aggressive ones, but even they become repetitive after the first **** story is almost non-existent unless you delve into secondary quests, which often feel like you're just running errands.I wish this game were as engaging as Sekiro, Bloodborne, or Dark Souls 3. Those games reward exploration and provide a sense of progression through gameplay, rather than relying solely on character stats.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">
        Read More
      </span> <!----> <!----></button></div> <!----></div></div> <div class="c-siteReview_extra u-grid u-grid-gap-medium g-inner-spacing-medium o-border-thin-top g-border-gray30 c-siteReview_extra-user"><!----> <div class="c-siteReview_externalLink g-color-gray80 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter c-siteReview_flag"><svg class="g-outer-spacing-right-small"><use xlink:href="#flag"></use></svg> <span class="g-text-link u-text-underline-under u-text-uppercase">Report</span></div> <!----> <div class="c-siteReview_platform g-text-bold g-color-gray80 g-text-xsmall u-text-right u-text-uppercase">
      Xbox Series X
    </div></div></div> <!----> <!----></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 5 out of 10" aria-label="User score 5 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_yellow c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-gray90 c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">5</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/HeideKnight/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="HeideKnight">
    HeideKnight
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    May 28, 2024
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>I have played Elden Ring for hundreds of hours. There will probably never ever be any other game which will come even close to this time investment. My first character, who is now in NG+2, has now about 300 hours on the clock and I am still enjoying playing this game a lot. So why, you might think, do I give this game only an average score? Other than probably many other players who started with Elden Ring as their first Soulslike game and who gave the game a higher score? I played all the original Souls games and I would like to rate the game as an evolution of the Souls genre that has been created by Fromsoft and which originated with Demon's Souls (2009) and which became popular with the widely acclaimed Dark Souls series (2011-2016). Elden Ring follows these footsteps and brings in new ideas, most importantly presents a coherent and massive open world. So for the first time a Soulslike game has this kind of setting and I generally like it that Fromsoft always try out new things with their brand instead of iterating the same type of game over and over again. However: the experiment failed this time. The open world in Elden Ring has just the same problems as many other action RPG's have that do not jail the player in combat encounters. Namely, the player can always run away and fight normal enemies or even bosses from a distance. While you would not do this most of the time, because it doesn't make much fun to play the game like this, the simple fact that this always is an option to the player removes any of the engaging atmospheres of the Dark Souls games where the environments are always spatially confined areas with a logical and challenging enemy placement combined sometimes with tricky platforming sections. All this is not well represented anymore in Elden Ring and I even have difficulties to see the game as a Soulslike game due to this when comparing it to other recent Soulslike games from other developers (Lies of P, Neowiz and Round8 (2023) and Lords of the Fallen, Hexworks (2023)). I can not list all the flaws of Elden Ring due to the openworld setting here, yet one aspect of it is very annoying and immersion breaking. Namely there are many field bosses who can despawn when you fought them on the edge of their spawn area. That is, enemies can not follow you across the whole map, but will eventually disappear in the middle (!) of the combat (!!) and you have to run back to their original spawning location to continue the fight. These are the situations where you notice: ah, yes, this is just a computer game made by bad programmers who do not understand (yet) how to build an open world with engaging enemy encounters. While this may sound harsh towards Fromsoft who made some of my most favourite games of all times, I think it is important that we, the players and fans of their games do not only see the good but also point to the bad design choices in their games. I also do not think that the Soulslike genre does not work well per se with an open world setting. But the above mentioned problems need to be addressed and maybe Fromsoft should take a look at other open world games in order to see how they can improve on their current iteration of the Soulslike games. To name but a few open world games: GTA5 or RDR2 by Rockstar Games are probably the best open world games ever made. They are not the same genre, of course, but what I mean here is, for example, that a police car that chases you in GTA5 will literally follow you across the whole map. The Rockstar open world games have no limits, no borders that restrict certain interactions. Another example I would like mention is Dragon's Dogma 2 (Capcom, 2024). Here the open world is in many areas segmented by spatial restrictions, like narrow valleys, rivers, buildings, caves, etc. Unlike Elden Ring's map, which has wide space areas most of the time. And this is a crucial distinction of the design of the map of both games. In fact, the environment with enemy encounters in DD2 are much more close to what one is used to in the classical Souls games which are non open world. In a nutshell: Elden Ring did not revolutionise open world games (as I have read in another review) but the developers still need to learn a lot on how to make a good open world game that supports the atmosphere and gameplay of a Souls game. Elden Ring was their first attempt on this, but it did not work out very well.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">
        Read More
      </span> <!----> <!----></button></div> <!----></div></div> <div class="c-siteReview_extra u-grid u-grid-gap-medium g-inner-spacing-medium o-border-thin-top g-border-gray30 c-siteReview_extra-user"><!----> <div class="c-siteReview_externalLink g-color-gray80 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter c-siteReview_flag"><svg class="g-outer-spacing-right-small"><use xlink:href="#flag"></use></svg> <span class="g-text-link u-text-underline-under u-text-uppercase">Report</span></div> <!----> <div class="c-siteReview_platform g-text-bold g-color-gray80 g-text-xsmall u-text-right u-text-uppercase">
      Xbox Series X

Still, it's an exceptional game worth exploring.</span></div> <!----> <!----></div></div> <div class="c-siteReview_extra u-grid u-grid-gap-medium g-inner-spacing-medium o-border-thin-top g-border-gray30 c-siteReview_extra-user"><!----> <div class="c-siteReview_externalLink g-color-gray80 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter c-siteReview_flag"><svg class="g-outer-spacing-right-small"><use xlink:href="#flag"></use></svg> <span class="g-text-link u-text-underline-under u-text-uppercase">Report</span></div> <!----> <div class="c-siteReview_platform g-text-bold g-color-gray80 g-text-xsmall u-text-right u-text-uppercase">
      Xbox Series X
    </div></div></div> <!----> <div class="c-adMpu g-bg-gray10 u-block c-pageProductReviews_ad-mobile-spacing"><div class="c-adMpu_ad c-adDisplay_container c-adDisplay_container_incontent_boxad spaced blank"><div data-ad="incontent_boxad" data-instance="0" data-disable-initial-load="true" data-constraint="all" class="u-text-center c-adDisplay"></div></div></div></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 9 out of 10" aria-label="User score 9 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_green c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-gray90 c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">9</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/Kalcool12/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="Kalcool12">
    Kalcool12
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Mar 8, 2024
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>This is a damn good game

This being my second even FromSoftware game, I was met with surprise. The game was difficult but never felt unfair. The challenge was high but never impossible. 

The biggest gripe I had with the game was the rigid leveling system. Items and upgrading equipment had me very confused and even now, I am left having to YouTube/Google certain things. And I do have a slight issue with the late-game difficulty, where I felt rewarded for being upper-leveled to just feel like I'm at square one in the late game. However, the pros of this game outweigh the cons.

I enjoy the world. Never has a world felt as rich as it does in an open-world video game. This cracks my top 3 open-world, right behind Red Dead II and Tears of the Kingdom. And then the combat... it's so fun. Learning the enemy move set and having the ability to use spells make the game so much more fun. I gained a whole other experience playing this game that I haven't felt since a Zelda title release. Definitely one of my favorite games of all time now.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

      Xbox Series X
    </div></div></div> <!----> <!----></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 10 out of 10" aria-label="User score 10 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_green c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-gray90 c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">10</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/Gamer025/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="Gamer025">
    Gamer025
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Feb 25, 2024
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>the combat is fun and the loop is addictive.

I think there are better “hard” games that ultimately feel more fair with better level design. Hollow Knight in particular comes to mind. However the world building in this game feels unparalleled and while a lot of the oversized bosses are not exactly fun to swing a sword at their feet, the spectacle is mostly interesting. 

The game is at it’s best when your working your way through any of the awesome legacy dungeon. 

There are a lot of walls you hit when level and stumbling into the wrong area (dragonbarrow for example). The game is probably too big and I would have been fine if they cut a 2 underground and 2 surface level areas. 

Ultimately the game is a ton of fun. World building, Leveling up, working on your build, finding the right weapon for the job are all amazing. There’s not a lot of talking or loading to impede the combat experience or immersion. these pros vastly outweigh the few cons.

Once your done it’s a lot of fun to jump into co-op and help others beat up on hard bosses</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

      Xbox Series X
    </div></div></div> <!----> <!----></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 8 out of 10" aria-label="User score 8 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_green c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-gray90 c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">8</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/liquifieddog/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="liquifieddog">
    liquifieddog
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Jan 13, 2024
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>I love the scale of the game and how the game ramps up in scale as you play the game. You start in an area that seems like a pretty big map already, then you start discovering more and more and add to that map that you originally thought was big until the area that you started in looks pretty much molecular compared to everywhere else that you’ve been. The areas are amazingly well crafted and are filled to the brim with things to do and items to collect, the story is interesting and easy to follow on the surface but becomes a satisfying tangled web as you start to dig deeper that only adds to the immersion of the game. Overall, the game is a masterpiece, but it isn’t my masterpiece. I’ll be the first to admit that I am bad at this game and actually have yet to finish it, I do love the story and everything that surrounds the game but I cannot for the life of me just sit down and complete the game. I am decently far into it and I know how the game ends but I am just unable to sit down and complete despite my love for the game.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">
        Read More
      </span> <!----> <!----></button></div> <!----></div></div> <div class="c-siteReview_extra u-grid u-grid-gap-medium g-inner-spacing-medium o-border-thin-top g-border-gray30 c-siteReview_extra-user"><!----> <div class="c-siteReview_externalLink g-color-gray80 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter c-siteReview_flag"><svg class="g-outer-spacing-right-small"><use xlink:href="#flag"></use></svg> <span class="g-text-link u-text-underline-under u-text-uppercase">Report</span></div> <!----> <div class="c-siteReview_platform g-text-bold g-color-gray80 g-text-xsmall u-text-right u-text-uppercase">
      Xbox Series X
    </div></div></div> <!----> <!----></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 6 out of 10" aria-label="User score 6 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_yellow c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-gray90 c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">6</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/DenisRovich/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="DenisRovich">
    DenisRovich
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Jan 7, 2024
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>This game is probably the most overrated game ever made.

It’s not a masterpiece and it has too much problems to be considered great. Empty open world, bad loot system, repetitive dungeons and catacombs, reused bosses (only 9 are original and not reused vs 23 of Dark Souls) non existent narrative, no quest log, uneven difficulty progression, unfair boss fights… I can go on. 6 out of 10 is too much but I’m willing to admit the the first 10 hours or so were a lot of fun and I’m willing to recommend this game just for that and the fact that the game is very beautiful artistically.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">
        Read More
      </span> <!----> <!----></button></div> <!----></div></div> <div class="c-siteReview_extra u-grid u-grid-gap-medium g-inner-spacing-medium o-border-thin-top g-border-gray30 c-siteReview_extra-user"><!----> <div class="c-siteReview_externalLink g-color-gray80 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter c-siteReview_flag"><svg class="g-outer-spacing-right-small"><use xlink:href="#flag"></use></svg> <span class="g-text-link u-text-underline-under u-text-uppercase">Report</span></div> <!----> <div class="c-siteReview_platform g-text-bold g-color-gray80 g-text-xsmall u-text-right u-text-uppercase">
      Xbox Series X
    </div></div></div> <!----> <!----></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 0 out of 10" aria-label="User score 0 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_red c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-white c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">0</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/SplitInfinity/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="SplitInfinity">
    SplitInfinity
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Jan 5, 2024
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>Multiplayer - READ THIS BEFORE BUYING FOR CO-OP gameplay and more so, search Reddit posts about multiplayer, I really wish we had!  Probably too late to return now for us.

I don't generally review a lot of games unless they are really exceptional in one way or another.  This one is so exceptionally bad for so called multiplayer that I literally signed up just to review it.

If you search for Elden Ring and multiplayer - you will read the overwhelmingly bad reviews about broken game mechanics in places like Reddit about their so called multiplayer.

It is so crippled as to be almost unplayable.  If you are interested in a single player game, then Elden Ring *might* actually be worth playing - a lot of things seem otherwise well done and we've occasionally had fun for 5-10 minutes out of hours of gameplay.

My friend and I purchased this game just to play together and hang out because it is specifically listed as a co-op game and has overall good ratings.  We only play socially, don't have time to waste on single player.  It is epically terrible.

You have to, in game, summon your friend in to play, they also have to cast a spell to join you which works half or better of the time ... it is novel the first time, tedious and frustrating to get it to work, but novel.  If that was it, cool, whatever, enjoy the rest of the evening.

But, once your friend is in the game, you can't roam anywhere without hitting a wall that you can only pass as a single player - you have to kick them out, transit, re-invite them waste 5+ minutes if it works right for absolutely no reason.

Some areas you can't invite them at all, or you're being attacked by a boss.  Then lets say you get them in to play and you don't hit a wall blocking multiplayer passage, someone dies, you defeat a boss, someone's network glitches, they get dropped from your game and spawn halfway back across the map.  You have to waste 10-15 minutes to virtually try and figure out a common place to spawn them back in, over and over again.  It is like they just don't want people to actually enjoy their game and have fun playing with friends.  Really, why even have a multiplayer if you can't do it halfway decently.

Co-op progress is also only for the host, so if you also want to get a new item, sword, spell, save point, or otherwise move forward, after playing the exact same thing as your friend - you have to play back through the exact same thing in your world all over again, and deal with getting kicked and disconnected over and over yet again too.

As if that isn't bad enough ...being a newer player right out of the gate who just wants to co-op and enjoy the game, you load into the world, you maybe get your friend in after 10 minutes of futzing around.  About every 10 minutes a human player who is there to do nothing but go attack other human players randomly spawns in, they are probably 50+ levels above you!

Typically, you hit them 4-5 times, and do maybe 5 percent damage - they hit you once and you die instantly.  Your friend gets kicked out and back across the map, you respawn and it completely disrupts the game while adding nothing but frustration - this isn't difficulty - this is unwanted PvP disruption.  You can't turn invasions off, you can't play multiplayer off-line, you can't just play with your friend.  Sure, we defeated the invaders a couple of times, but they are almost always higher level players, disruptive!

The game is already very hard from the start, you could be in the middle of fighting 3-4 tough enemies.  Those enemies don't attack invaders, but the invaders will walk right up behind you while you are in an already difficult fight and one hit kill you from behind.

There is a counter invasion, where you can *eventually* summon in a hunter to help you fight the human invader - you're probably dead before they actually summon in after a few minutes, and it still doesn't fix the terrible mechanic.  If you want PvP have a flipping arena or turn the feature on via opt in.

Some users argue that the only way to make the already challenging game challenging, is to keep the game disrupting invasions from human players - this is completely untrue and if I want a good co-op experience against the game, I shouldn't be forced to play with rando invaders disrupting the already terrible multiplayer mechanics.  It seems like someone just likes harassing's other players and thinks they can somehow argue their desire to ruin other people's days as making good gameplay.  (It should be an opt in ONLY feature if present at all, I'm sure the majority would opt out.)

We unfortunately bought this a bit ago, knowing what I know now, we would have returned it immediately or skipped it altogether.  Which is sad, because the game has promise - if multiplayer wasn't completely crippled.

We still keep trying, hoping to have fun and just finding night after night of frustrating time wasting hoops and harassment preventing enjoyment of the actual gameplay.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">
        Read More

  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">

  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>Elden Ring is an excellent game (GOTY 2022) and possibly the best soulslike ever created. What i really liked after 150 hours of playing and the platinum trophy is that this game wants and succeds on treating you like a clever person and not a dumb braindead gamer who only needs 2 buttons to play a game or watch 30 hours of cinematics or depend on QTEs in combat all the time. The game demands intelligence and imagination from you, from exploration to customization and from skill and technique to fast reflexes. I mean, Dark Souls 3 and Bloodborne already had these things but now they are even better. The ONLY 2 reasons that hold it back from true greatness imo (9/10 and not 10/10) are, first, the story is almost non-existent and second, the technical side in general, both in terms of graphics and music/sounds/ost, could be better. I mean, i played Hogwarts Legacy and then came back immediately to play again Elden Ring and it seemed to me like a game from 2015 or something. Nevertheless, a true must-buy for every soulslike lover or action rpg gamer in general.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

Cannot wait for the expansion!</span></div> <!----> <!----></div></div> <div class="c-siteReview_extra u-grid u-grid-gap-medium g-inner-spacing-medium o-border-thin-top g-border-gray30 c-siteReview_extra-user"><!----> <div class="c-siteReview_externalLink g-color-gray80 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter c-siteReview_flag"><svg class="g-outer-spacing-right-small"><use xlink:href="#flag"></use></svg> <span class="g-text-link u-text-underline-under u-text-uppercase">Report</span></div> <!----> <div class="c-siteReview_platform g-text-bold g-color-gray80 g-text-xsmall u-text-right u-text-uppercase">

    Oct 29, 2023
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>Awesome 
Love it</span></div> <!----> <!----></div></div> <div class="c-siteReview_extra u-grid u-grid-gap-medium g-inner-spacing-medium o-border-thin-top g-border-gray30 c-siteReview_extra-user"><!----> <div class="c-siteReview_externalLink g-color-gray80 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter c-siteReview_flag"><svg class="g-outer-spacing-right-small"><use xlink:href="#flag"></use></svg> <span class="g-text-link u-text-underline-under u-text-uppercase">Report</span></div> <!----> <div class="c-siteReview_platform g-text-bold g-color-gray80 g-text-xsmall u-text-right u-text-uppercase">
      Xbox Series X
    </div></div></div> <!----> <!----></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 8 out of 10" aria-label="User score 8 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_green c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-gray90 c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">8</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/LordLongNut/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="LordLongNut">
    LordLongNut
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Oct 23, 2023
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>Somewhat flawed in world design, levels look amazing but often lack in interconnection and atmosphere. The map feels too large and the best parts are often the legacy dungeons which feel like actual souls levels. The areas are beautiful to look at and you can basically go everywhere you see which is cool but it could’ve been considerably smaller so it could cut down on all those repeat bosses. Downgrade from older instalments feels like a minor upgrade from DS3 with slim quality of life improvements. Some bosses are great and fun or other are too easy and boring while others are unfair and poorly designed. This game is great but definitely has flaws and is no masterpiece 
Pros and some thoughts-
-Build variety and amount of weapons
-Spectacle and area settings (areas are often beautiful to look at and it has some good world building with how your in a world that’s been lost to a war)
-Legacy dungeons (Leyndell, Volcano Manor, Stormviel)
-Underground areas (Nokstella and Nokron)
-Lore for certain bosses and the world is fascinating
-Combat is rewarding and learning movesets can be enjoyable
-Some boss OSTs are memorable (Fortisaxx and Godskin duo) those are some notable ones for me
-Good overall quality of life improvements compared to past instalments but doesn’t add any new crazy gameplay mechanics
-Very accessible with its open world allowing you to explore and gain levels from 150 repeat dungeon and catacomb bosses
-2/4 of remembrance bosses are enjoyable and all are very unique and have great design and depth to their movesets and gameplay mechanics 


It succeeds at theses pros all at different levels but overall it was decently well rounded with design flaws and with its positives

Also Fias quest is the best in the game it’s a better journey than Ranni’s and actually has some meaning and backstory to it. I
Cons-
-The enemy reskins and re fights (157 total bosses and only 9 are unique that you only fight once, they are Renala, Rykard, Radahn, Malenia, Fire Giant, Placidusaxx, Sir Gideon, Maliketh, &amp; Radagon. Every other boss in the game you refight more than once. The game should’ve been cut in size because this is just completely unnecessary and can ruin how memorable and unique these boss fights are supposed to be. The fights are fun but there’s too much repetition. I know other games do this but maybe not to this extent. This ruins the value of the world and makes it feel meaningless and ruins immersion. Ruins the standard of the other games 
-Broken weapons (Bleed related in particular) 
- lots poorly designed bosses(Malenia, Fire Giant, elden beast, all 30 of the basic dragon refights, tree avatars, Godskin duo. There is more but these are the best examples)
-Awful camera in boss fights it is the true enemy 
-Lore is too vague and reading item descriptions doesn’t pay off to tell a complete story. It tries to hard to be mysterious and it never has any reasons for anything. Vagueness is what we are used to with this series yet this one doesn’t succeed in it for the most part.
-Open world is bland and exploring got boring and annoying it doesn’t add much and is a schlock to go through again on NG+. I don’t feel engaged exploring the world it takes no risks, has too many bonfires and checkpoints everywhere, there’s no interconnection and no reason to make a mental memory of everything when there’s no risk. It feels like DS3 level design but I guess slightly better. The world only exists to be a spectacle and doesn’t do anything else to interweave the map and immerse you. It’s hollow and only succeeds in legacy dungeons. I think having a dedicated map is a main reason for this feeling for me. I’d rather explore the unknown rather than have a map and a player marker. 
-Side quest are quite literally impossible to do without a guide it’s absurd, the map is just too big to actually complete it yourself and the dialogue is too vague to tell you to do anything. The community has normalized using guides and the wiki for everything. The proof is there: the 16 step ranni quest has a 25% completion rate. This is bad quest design 
- I swear every single boss arena is a circle with a different background. No environmental hazards no different strategies for unique arenas, nothing and that’s boring. Only one I can think of is malikeths arena with the ledges.
-Delayed attacks on every boss. Lots of aoe and unpredictable speedy, long range attacks that catch you in a 8 hit combo that will often get you killed. I don’t want to spend 10 hours on a boss, it doesn’t prove anything to anyone. 2-4 hours is a good amount. Most are boring and unfun and don’t teach the player anything at all other than to get annoyed at the **** is all just roll, get 2 hits in for most bosses. It can feel unreactable at times and ruins the experience. This game chooses spectacle over meaningful mechanics in a fight, it looks cool but it doesn’t actually play well
Overall it’s a great game but no masterpiece</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">
        Read More

    jezzipin
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">

      Xbox Series X
    </div></div></div> <!----> <div class="c-adMpu g-bg-gray10 u-block c-pageProductReviews_ad-mobile-spacing"><div class="c-adMpu_ad c-adDisplay_container c-adDisplay_container_incontent_boxad spaced blank"><div data-ad="incontent_boxad" data-instance="0" data-disable-initial-load="true" data-constraint="all" class="u-text-center c-adDisplay"></div></div></div></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 9 out of 10" aria-label="User score 9 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_green c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-gray90 c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">9</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/TheGamerGuide/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="TheGamerGuide">
    TheGamerGuide
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Sep 26, 2023
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>Elden Ring offers up a gorgeous open world that is enticing and exciting to explore, along with excellent combat variety, amazing bosses to fight, and intricate dungeons to tackle. It might feel a little familiar, but this could well be FromSoftware’s best game to date.

TGG – 9 / 10

AUDIO 9/10
The music in Elden Ring is excellent, and each boss fight track gives the battle its own vibe. Ambient sounds help to make the open world feel more alive, and what voice acting there is in the game is very high quality.

VISUALS 9/10
Elden Ring’s art direction is absolutely stunning, and the steep cliffs, golden trees, and misty lakes of the game’s open world are wonderful to behold. Unfortunately, some technical problems hold the game back, with particle effects like fire not loading into view until you’re extremely close to them.

PLAYABILITY 9/10
Elden Ring takes the combat of Dark Souls and expands upon it in interesting and worthwhile ways. Stealth is a welcome addition, combat atop your steed Torrent feels epic, and the vast array of magic spells and weapon abilities mean there’s plenty of ways to take down your foes.

DELIVERY 9/10
Elden Ring’s open world is a joy to explore, with something new to discover around every corner, and it offers a ton of verticality, as well as wide open areas. The more linear dungeons are really well made, but progression can be a little bit confusing at times. Loading times are far too long, as well.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">
        Read More

  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>Way better than starfield, that game was terrible. If you liked starfield play this instead.</span></div> <!----> <!----></div></div> <div class="c-siteReview_extra u-grid u-grid-gap-medium g-inner-spacing-medium o-border-thin-top g-border-gray30 c-siteReview_extra-user"><!----> <div class="c-siteReview_externalLink g-color-gray80 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter c-siteReview_flag"><svg class="g-outer-spacing-right-small"><use xlink:href="#flag"></use></svg> <span class="g-text-link u-text-underline-under u-text-uppercase">Report</span></div> <!----> <div class="c-siteReview_platform g-text-bold g-color-gray80 g-text-xsmall u-text-right u-text-uppercase">

Style handling Performance</span></div> <!----> <!----></div></div> <div class="c-siteReview_extra u-grid u-grid-gap-medium g-inner-spacing-medium o-border-thin-top g-border-gray30 c-siteReview_extra-user"><!----> <div class="c-siteReview_externalLink g-color-gray80 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter c-siteReview_flag"><svg class="g-outer-spacing-right-small"><use xlink:href="#flag"></use></svg> <span class="g-text-link u-text-underline-under u-text-uppercase">Report</span></div> <!----> <div class="c-siteReview_platform g-text-bold g-color-gray80 g-text-xsmall u-text-right u-text-uppercase">
      Xbox Series X
    </div></div></div> <!----> <!----></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 10 out of 10" aria-label="User score 10 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_green c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-gray90 c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">10</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/litnlowkey/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="litnlowkey">
    litnlowkey
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Sep 7, 2023
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>The most beautifully written and well crafted video game in the history of video games. Elden Ring proves to be a massively intimidating but intensely captivating experience with a focused yet ever expansive goal. The excellence of the world building provided by George R.R. Martin and the powerful writing of Hidetaka Miyazaki mesh extremely well into a very cohesive experience rivalling the most popular intellectual property the fantasy genre has to date. Its use of the visual and interactive medium to convey messages, evoke emotion, and to inspire awe reflect the work of true masters of the craft.

The game plays as an evolution to From Softwares flagship series, Dark Souls, with an infusion of elements from their more recent breakout hit, Sekiro: Shadows Die Twice. It goes further to add its own unique characteristic’s providing the player with a large and varied toolset allowing for a wide choice of play-styles. It’s more subtle take on quests is impactful and requires actively engaging with games story in a way many games never come close to accomplishing. As you move through the ever-growing world, you begin to acquire the sense of just how vast the play-space is, and how small and inconsequential you feel in comparison to it. The stories multiple endings provide the ability for a second or third play through with a breath of fresh air, making great use of the games new game plus feature.

Like all games, it doesn’t come without its flaws though. Its high difficulty being a major barrier to entry is one of the best examples, but stands as one that is important to the fundamental experience itself. Another would be its strange approach to cooperative play, being overly restrictive in the modern era of co-op games. Despite its potential flaws, Elden Ring stands as one of the very few titles worthy of the masterpiece rating.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">
        Read More
      </span> <!----> <!----></button></div> <!----></div></div> <div class="c-siteReview_extra u-grid u-grid-gap-medium g-inner-spacing-medium o-border-thin-top g-border-gray30 c-siteReview_extra-user"><!----> <div class="c-siteReview_externalLink g-color-gray80 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter c-siteReview_flag"><svg class="g-outer-spacing-right-small"><use xlink:href="#flag"></use></svg> <span class="g-text-link u-text-underline-under u-text-uppercase">Report</span></div> <!----> <div class="c-siteReview_platform g-text-bold g-color-gray80 g-text-xsmall u-text-right u-text-uppercase">
      Xbox Series X

  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Sep 7, 2023
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>I originally gave this game a negative review on Steam as I found that the lack of direction really hurt the games flow. I still hold that sentiment about Elden Ring.
I don't expect the game to give me a guided tour or arrows on the hud to tell me where exactly where to go, but at times I was wandering into zones I clearly shouldn't be in, undergeared, not high enough level and still on like 4 flasks to top me up.

Recently I picked this back up and followed a guide, yes I know what a scrub, but I thought that if I can get a rough guide on what weapons are where, and how I should reasonbly progress, I will then get along with this game. Sure enough, I fell in love.

Now is this game perfect? No. Is it loyal to it's core audience? Absolutely. If Demon or Dark Souls are something you enjoyed or even love-hated for it's punish factor, you will adore this game.

The amount of times I just took a minute to appreciate the glorious views is countless, yes even dreary Caelid. Once you get into the swing of things you really can't put the game down, it envelopes you with it's "push on" layout.

So after clearly with a bit ****, I will replay this for sure, might make a meme build or even the Holiest build, Jesus Himself.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

Não encontrei nenhum bug ao longo da gameplay e nem um problema técnico que tenha me atrapalhado.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

      Xbox Series X
    </div></div></div> <!----> <!----></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 10 out of 10" aria-label="User score 10 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_green c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-gray90 c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">10</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/Augoosetus/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="Augoosetus">
    Augoosetus
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Aug 26, 2023
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>Rating; 9.7

This game is probably my favorite game of all time, and for good reason. I am a huge fan of Fromsoftware games, and have played every single one. This game lives up to all those previous games legacy, with a fantastic world to explore, marvelous combat, weapon as well as magic variety, and wicked bosses. Plus, all of the new mechanics that this game offers to the souls like genre are marvelously done, with the horse feeling pretty good, jumping adding a whole nother layer to combat as well as exploration, and the open world, which is just phenomenal.

Now, this game isn’t perfect. To start off with there is numerous repeated boss fight’s, and the dungeons are really, in most instances, underwhelming. Overall, this is a game that I would always recommend to fans of the souls series, and I would even recommend anyone who haven’t play the Souls game before, to give this one a shot.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>Pros

- Fluid combat, huge amount of choice.
- Main Story bosses are well designed.
- The Areas feel alive, I actually wanted to explore just to see new areas.

Cons

- The amount of reused bosses and assets in some of the the side dungeons / areas is fairly lazy. There are 2 Mohg's too, which really doesn't make since as he's a pinnacle boss.
- Much of the story just doesn't make sense and feels low effort to make the player interpret much of what is going on.

      Xbox Series X
    </div></div></div> <!----> <!----></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 10 out of 10" aria-label="User score 10 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_green c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-gray90 c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">10</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/Kio22/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="Kio22">
    Kio22
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Jul 20, 2023
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>After 156 hours I completed Elden Ring along with about 95% of the character side quests and all optional and main bosses. This game has one of the best worlds to explore I've ever seen in any game I have played; the visuals are spectacular and not one single inch feels wasted. One of my favorite things about this game is every weapon and spell looks cool but also feel viable to the point you can pretty much make any build you want. This game is the peak of From Software's design in Dark Souls in giving freedom to the players to play however they want. The fluid combat and the added ability to jump add to the great experience of fighting and exploring in this game. The games story like other soul's games is very obscure but also very rich if you are willing to look for it. The characters are mostly good, but I felt they could have done more with certain ones. Most main game bosses feel and look very cool and are fun to fight. Some people don't like the reuse of enemies throughout the game but overall, I think they did a good job of making them unique to the areas you fight them and the powers they use, making them feel like new enemies. Difficulty wise Elden Ring is probably the 2nd easiest soul's game with Dark Souls 2 being the easiest. With 85 deaths in Elden Ring total, 46 of which were due to Malenia leaving 39 from the rest of the game compared to, 38 deaths in Dark Souls 1, 55 deaths in Dark Souls 3, and 9 deaths in Dark souls 2 (DS2 just felt extremely easy). One problem I had was Malenia and her being able to use her waterfowl dance 5 times in the span of a 2 minutes using it every other attack, if I could change one thing, I would give that move a 60 second cool down after she uses it. Overall, Elden Ring has slight issues with difficulty balancing but they are so small that it doesn't change how amazing this game is.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

A world so unparalleled in size, yet scaled ro nearest reach, to furthest of horizons perfectly. A world so varied, yet so deliberate in layout; and every perspective guiding towards some point of view. A world, Elden Ring; is one of if not the finest in gaming: Art direction/Boss Enemy variety/Build variety/Layout/Scale/Variation, it has no rival; nothing close to an equal. a bold continuation/ defined evolution of Fromsoftware's games, and often total succession of their prior ventures.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>100hours+
Once I open the game, I feel I’m the character.
Try to fight every battle in elden ring.

At the end, I become the king. Wish I can play it again</span></div> <!----> <!----></div></div> <div class="c-siteReview_extra u-grid u-grid-gap-medium g-inner-spacing-medium o-border-thin-top g-border-gray30 c-siteReview_extra-user"><!----> <div class="c-siteReview_externalLink g-color-gray80 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter c-siteReview_flag"><svg class="g-outer-spacing-right-small"><use xlink:href="#flag"></use></svg> <span class="g-text-link u-text-underline-under u-text-uppercase">Report</span></div> <!----> <div class="c-siteReview_platform g-text-bold g-color-gray80 g-text-xsmall u-text-right u-text-uppercase">

      Xbox Series X
    </div></div></div> <!----> <!----></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 10 out of 10" aria-label="User score 10 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_green c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-gray90 c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">10</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/ShadozeGG/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="ShadozeGG">
    ShadozeGG
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Jun 24, 2023
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>Elden Ring is an extraordinary and rewarding gaming experience that celebrates exploration and discovery. With no hand-holding or markers to guide the player, it offers a vast and immersive world filled with hidden corners and remarkable caves. Despite occasional challenges with cooperative play, the game's stunning visuals and seamless gameplay make it a triumph, solidifying its place among the greatest role-playing games ever created. FromSoftware has skillfully blended the mechanics of Dark Souls with refined exploration, resulting in a fresh perspective that sets Elden Ring apart in the oversaturated market of open-world games. It is a remarkable achievement that pushes the boundaries of the genre and leaves an indelible mark on its players.

Elden Ring represents a significant milestone for its developers and stands as one of the most exceptional titles in recent years. It combines the brilliance and challenge of its predecessors with captivating innovations, offering a gaming experience that transcends mere entertainment. While some may lament the departure from familiar tropes, Elden Ring retains the best mechanics and delivers a wealth of new and captivating elements, establishing itself as a groundbreaking evolution in the genre. It is a testament to the beauty of progress and firmly establishes FromSoftware's magnum opus.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">
        Read More

      Xbox Series X
    </div></div></div> <!----> <!----></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 10 out of 10" aria-label="User score 10 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_green c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-gray90 c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">10</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/NotMyCabbages/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="NotMyCabbages">
    NotMyCabbages
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    May 15, 2023
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>Elden Ring is an expansive, jaw-droppingly beautiful game with what is probably the best open world in terms of it's scale, every location looks like its out of a piece of concept art for a fantasy world. So much love and effort was put into the world of this game and I loved every minute of dying over and over in attempts to find treasure in every corner of the map, just to be trapped and transported to a region with outlandish creatures far above my level. You never know what to expect in the world, what abominations await you around ever corner.

Even better are the Shard Bearer boss battles each in their own region, theme and each with meticulously designed move sets to be just difficult enough to be near impossible at certain levels, but still doable. Exploration is key in this world as it can award you a plethora of unique weapons, magics and summons that can help aid you in these colossal fights with the demi-human giants.

Gameplay honestly could do with a little tweaking, the lock on system is a little dodgy at times. It isn't bad enough to warrant any kind of negative score for though just a bit of criticism. The starting area is also a little difficult if you aren't familiar with the way the levelling system works. Some items can be scarce at the beginning, but with patience and time you will build up your arsenal slowly and progressively quicker as the game goes on.

If you are willing to pour dozens of hours into the game you get a fantastic experience, but you have to understand what it is you're getting into, you will die - A LOT - but that gives you the experience you need to progress further into the game. Don't give up, keep trying or come back to that area at a later time with better gear and a new strategy.

10/10 one of the best games you can play if you love giant boss battles and beautiful open worlds.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">
        Read More
      </span> <!----> <!----></button></div> <!----></div></div> <div class="c-siteReview_extra u-grid u-grid-gap-medium g-inner-spacing-medium o-border-thin-top g-border-gray30 c-siteReview_extra-user"><!----> <div class="c-siteReview_externalLink g-color-gray80 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter c-siteReview_flag"><svg class="g-outer-spacing-right-small"><use xlink:href="#flag"></use></svg> <span class="g-text-link u-text-underline-under u-text-uppercase">Report</span></div> <!----> <div class="c-siteReview_platform g-text-bold g-color-gray80 g-text-xsmall u-text-right u-text-uppercase">

Nothing in this game makes it comparable to true masterpieces such as Red Dead Redemption 2 or Breath of the Wild. And most importantly: it's not fun at all.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

      Xbox Series X
    </div></div></div> <!----> <!----></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 9 out of 10" aria-label="User score 9 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_green c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-gray90 c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">9</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/Pasticle/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="Pasticle">
    Pasticle
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Mar 27, 2023
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>Las bases de un juego perfecto se vieron arruinadas por la ambición de su publisher. Con un desbalance premeritado para que tenga vía libre hacia el mainstream, Elden Ring invirtió esmero en lograr ser apto para todos los jugadores, rompiendo asi no solo su mecánicamente perfecto sistema de combate, si no la esencia de desafio.
Bosses repetidos en dungeons copiadas y pegadas, hacen que este juego sea un mundo abierto carente de incentivo en el late game para muchos de los jugadores.  El juego tranquilamente podria haber funcionado con un 30% menos de dungeons y hubiera mejorado si se hubiera invertido en generar mas eventos en el mundo abierto (algo de lo que se alardeo en el trailer y solo pasa 2 o 3 veces si no contamos los carros con trols)

Excesiva inspiración en BOTW al desarrollar tanto escenarios como el gamefeel de atravesar el mundo abierto tomando como base Zelda, olvidando que lo que siempre hizo a Zelda una aventura digna, es avanzar (y en el caso de botw, explorar) gracias a mecanicas constantemente evolutivas que generan no solo un backtracking digno, si no que tambien una sensacion de desarrollo mas alla de mejores armas y mas nivel.
Obviamente el objetivo de los juegos de fromsoft es siempre la parte mecánica y en elden ring el combate es el foco desde el comienzo hasta el final, pero la contrapartida de utilizar un mundo tan grande con tan poco crecimiento, genera que las futuras playthrough sean exclusivamente a probar el combate de distintas formas, dejando al mapa como una experiencia MUY BUENA, pero que se desgasta luego de la primera exploración.

Cosas buenas sobran y se saben del juego, pero no esta cerca de ser la culminación  de la experiencia de fromsoftware a lo largo de los años como muchos marcan. Tristemente peca de cosas que hacen muchos juegos AAA modernos para preponderar primeras impresiones antes que profundidad.

El lore me parece el mejor y mas acertado de todos los Souls, con un desarrollo preciso que deja a interpretación la medida exacta al jugador, algo en lo que DS3 fallo con creces.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

Dark Souls on steroids.</span></div> <!----> <!----></div></div> <div class="c-siteReview_extra u-grid u-grid-gap-medium g-inner-spacing-medium o-border-thin-top g-border-gray30 c-siteReview_extra-user"><!----> <div class="c-siteReview_externalLink g-color-gray80 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter c-siteReview_flag"><svg class="g-outer-spacing-right-small"><use xlink:href="#flag"></use></svg> <span class="g-text-link u-text-underline-under u-text-uppercase">Report</span></div> <!----> <div class="c-siteReview_platform g-text-bold g-color-gray80 g-text-xsmall u-text-right u-text-uppercase">
      Xbox Series X
    </div></div></div> <!----> <!----></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 10 out of 10" aria-label="User score 10 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_green c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-gray90 c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">10</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/Base-PrimeMover/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="Base-PrimeMover">
    Base-PrimeMover
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Mar 12, 2023
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>Elden Ring is the pinnacle of game design and a breath of fresh air. Bold words, I know but in an era of handholding, barren open worlds, micro transactions and stuffed HUD’s elden ring stands apart. The score and sound design are epic, the gameplay is tight, the art direction is the best in gaming and the boss battles are both numerous and challenging making it a game ****, a game that may steer game direction in the coming years.</span></div> <!----> <!----></div></div> <div class="c-siteReview_extra u-grid u-grid-gap-medium g-inner-spacing-medium o-border-thin-top g-border-gray30 c-siteReview_extra-user"><!----> <div class="c-siteReview_externalLink g-color-gray80 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter c-siteReview_flag"><svg class="g-outer-spacing-right-small"><use xlink:href="#flag"></use></svg> <span class="g-text-link u-text-underline-under u-text-uppercase">Report</span></div> <!----> <div class="c-siteReview_platform g-text-bold g-color-gray80 g-text-xsmall u-text-right u-text-uppercase">
      Xbox Series X
