  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>Elden Ring is honestly a masterpiece ****. I was quite hesitant on the SoulsBorne series but after playing this game for the first time I was blown away. I honestly regret not trying it sooner. From Graphics to gameplay, this game is a play everyone should play once. I understand that the difficulty is a turn off for a lot of people but the feeling of beating a boss is one of the greatest feelings I've ever had. The lands between is such an amazing open world map, the fact that everything you can see everything in the distance is really there is baffling, a lot of games simply put a jpg in the background and call it a day but in Elden Ring you can go to anything you see. FromSoftware seriously out-did themselves with this and I cant recommend it enough. Please go play this game.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

    Pewpskii
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Jan 26, 2023
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>A worthy new title to follow up the sublime Dark Souls series. Fixed and improved upon almost every issue I had with Dark Souls III, and the Ash of War system is a worthy successor to the Weapon Art system. The open world is admirable and is up there with the greats of open world games.</span></div> <!----> <!----></div></div> <div class="c-siteReview_extra u-grid u-grid-gap-medium g-inner-spacing-medium o-border-thin-top g-border-gray30 c-siteReview_extra-user"><!----> <div class="c-siteReview_externalLink g-color-gray80 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter c-siteReview_flag"><svg class="g-outer-spacing-right-small"><use xlink:href="#flag"></use></svg> <span class="g-text-link u-text-underline-under u-text-uppercase">Report</span></div> <!----> <div class="c-siteReview_platform g-text-bold g-color-gray80 g-text-xsmall u-text-right u-text-uppercase">
      Xbox Series X
    </div></div></div> <!----> <!----></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 10 out of 10" aria-label="User score 10 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_green c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-gray90 c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">10</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/slaine130177/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="slaine130177">
    slaine130177
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Jan 22, 2023
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>Fini Elden Ring sur Xbox Series X. 107h de jeux pour obtenir la fin la plus rare (celle de la flamme frénétique) et level 170 pour mon personnage.

Déjà, un premier point négatif sur la technique, le mode Qualité n'apporte rien visuellement et se permet d'avoir un fps trop bas pour ce type de jeu. C'est immédiatement visible. Préférez donc le mode Performance qui est parfait (je joue pourtant sur une Oled avec VRR). Point positif, la version Xbox bénéficie du Dolby Vision, non disponible sur PS5. Les contrastes sont donc meilleurs avec une colorimétrie plus maîtrisé. Top.

Enfin, concernant le jeu, la DA est magnifique, l'univers réussi, et l'open World tient toutes ses promesses. Le monde est immense, bourré de secrets. On a l'impression de ne jamais en voir la fin.
Je n'avais jamais fait de jeux From Software jusqu'à ce jour (à part le 1er Dark Souls que j'avais lâché à cause de son gameplay très lent et sa difficulté qui m'avait rebuté à l'époque).
Le jeu est donc totalement accessible pour n'importe quel joueur, et ça c'est vraiment une bonne chose. Si on bute sur un boss ou une zone, pas grave, on y revient plus **** quand on est mieux équipé et avec un perso plus fort. Ca finit toujours par passé, et même Mélania le boss le plus difficile de jeu, ne sera pas insurmontable.

Les principaux défauts pour moi:
- recyclage omniprésent des boss. Entre les dragons, les statues chats, les mages, les vers et j'en passe. C'est vraiment dommage de ne pas avoir diversifié davantage ces "mini boss".
- un scénario un peu obscur et difficile à suivre à mon goût
- un inventaire brouillon et des objets souvent incompréhensibles (les indications fournies sont trop succintes, voir obscures)
- des quêtes annexes où on ne sait jamais si elles sont finies. Il manque juste un onglet avec l'état d'avancement des quêtes. On peut passer à côté de beaucoup de chose parce que tout est très confu au niveau histoire et suivi

En conclusion, Elden Ring mérite tout de même tous les compliments qu'il a reçu et reste un grand jeu. Presque 110 heures passés sur le jeu et je ne me suis jamais ennuyé. Preuve que la recette est bonne.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">
        Read More
      </span> <!----> <!----></button></div> <!----></div></div> <div class="c-siteReview_extra u-grid u-grid-gap-medium g-inner-spacing-medium o-border-thin-top g-border-gray30 c-siteReview_extra-user"><!----> <div class="c-siteReview_externalLink g-color-gray80 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter c-siteReview_flag"><svg class="g-outer-spacing-right-small"><use xlink:href="#flag"></use></svg> <span class="g-text-link u-text-underline-under u-text-uppercase">Report</span></div> <!----> <div class="c-siteReview_platform g-text-bold g-color-gray80 g-text-xsmall u-text-right u-text-uppercase">

    Jan 10, 2023
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>Amazing game. However, due to how long it is, repeated boss fights are annoying. The game is long enough they could have just omitted these. (And I'd recommend just skipping them when possible)
This is the only thing stopping it from getting a 10/10 from me.
It would have been nice if it had more true challenges late game, past Radahn (pre nerf) the game definitely goes straight into easy mode, until the final boss where it tips upwards, slightly.
Subsequent playthroughs were also a little disappointing as Radahn's nerf really made him a joke. Glad I got to do the fight in its original form.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Jan 2, 2023
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>First off if you think Elden ring is “too hard” you’re not taking advantage of the games mechanics, there are plenty of ways to make the game easier if not too easy at times to be considered a souls game . First time playing I found it difficult until I figured out what areas to go to first and where to come back too. The areas in elden ring are set up perfectly to where you can progress without a serious challenge depending where you go next. If you have a problem with leveling up then you have yet to explore many areas because I found myself getting too strong for the main game . Lastly I hear a lot of complaints about the story being too hard to understand and I’m gonna tell you right now it’s only hard if you can’t put 2 and 2 together . You’re gonna need to google some words and maybe play the game a few times but you will understand the story as long as you can read and have an expanded vocabulary. Nearly every item description plays a role in telling you the story, you NEED to take your time and remember what npcs tell you . If you’re not able to do these things you will not understand anything and have a hard time for sure. And if you’re not willing to put in the work of unraveling this incredible story then don’t even bother writing a review about something you haven’t even fully experienced</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

There isn't a pause menu in the game. To me it seems the developers have issues on the technical side and they settle down with it. "It's not a bug it's a feature".

I don't see what is the point making a game, If you already know only 10% of the buyers will finish it. This game isn't hard, it is clunky, because the developers can't Scale difficulty and they label it as souls like.
The world and the enemy design looks cool, but as an entertainment product it fails to entertain.
It is like jerking off with a cheese grater.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

      Xbox Series X
    </div></div></div> <!----> <!----></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 1 out of 10" aria-label="User score 1 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_red c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-white c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">1</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/EldenRingisBadd/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="EldenRingisBadd">
    EldenRingisBadd
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Dec 10, 2022
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>Cons:
No animation canceling making the game feel clunky as your not able to tell your character what to do as its stuck in a 2s animation you can’t get out of in the middle of a fight
Roll animation and roll negation damaged are not synced as you will take hits within your roll animation constantly.
Little support for PC controls
PC performance bugs, such as game freezing up and not responding every time to click quit game
Cutscenes are awkward as they are stuck behind cutting in and out of black screens and changing camera perspective
Little explanation for the game and the mechanics, it didn’t tell me the imperative detail of progression being leveling up until I had played for almost 4 hours
Insufficient explanation of core game design decisions and mechanics that the developers left to hope the players would just spend hours without this knowledge until they figured it out
Lack of early game narrative gives your character a lack of purpose as your just running around a world you know nothing about and don’t care about to kill enemies you know nothing about and care nothing about
It’s hard to call a game like this an “RPG” because RPGs usually have good immersion however the immersion is broken with this game once you get a loading screen and are teleported away every time you die, which happens a lot by design with this game
Enemies always respawning also breaks immersion and makes you clearing an area feel unrewarding

Overall this game is a **** fest where you spawn in with no purpose and are tasked with killing enemies that attack quicker than half your attacks, attack animation duration(something you can’t cancel). Who also hit you during your roll animation(not synced to negation bad game design) making the core draw of this game the combat a poor experience.

Pros
Good character creation
Expansive world
A lot of unique enemies
Difficulty
Customization of combat style

Although this game has some pros they are greatly overshadowed by the long list of cons</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

    violet97

    Dec 7, 2022
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>Elden Ring is developed by From Software and published by Bandai Namco Games</span></div> <!----> <!----></div></div> <div class="c-siteReview_extra u-grid u-grid-gap-medium g-inner-spacing-medium o-border-thin-top g-border-gray30 c-siteReview_extra-user"><!----> <div class="c-siteReview_externalLink g-color-gray80 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter c-siteReview_flag"><svg class="g-outer-spacing-right-small"><use xlink:href="#flag"></use></svg> <span class="g-text-link u-text-underline-under u-text-uppercase">Report</span></div> <!----> <div class="c-siteReview_platform g-text-bold g-color-gray80 g-text-xsmall u-text-right u-text-uppercase">
      Xbox Series X
    </div></div></div> <!----> <!----></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 0 out of 10" aria-label="User score 0 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_red c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-white c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">0</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/Marinne/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="Marinne">
    Marinne
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Dec 7, 2022
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>Elden Ring foi uma experiência bem meme desde o seu lançamento. Joguei no PC e o desempenho estava péssimo, nos consoles em alguns casos não foi muito diferente. O jogo não me prendeu em nada, um mundo aberto bem genérico e preguiçoso.</span></div> <!----> <!----></div></div> <div class="c-siteReview_extra u-grid u-grid-gap-medium g-inner-spacing-medium o-border-thin-top g-border-gray30 c-siteReview_extra-user"><!----> <div class="c-siteReview_externalLink g-color-gray80 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter c-siteReview_flag"><svg class="g-outer-spacing-right-small"><use xlink:href="#flag"></use></svg> <span class="g-text-link u-text-underline-under u-text-uppercase">Report</span></div> <!----> <div class="c-siteReview_platform g-text-bold g-color-gray80 g-text-xsmall u-text-right u-text-uppercase">
      Xbox Series X
    </div></div></div> <!----> <!----></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 10 out of 10" aria-label="User score 10 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_green c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-gray90 c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">10</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/Ulriken/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="Ulriken">
    Ulriken
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Dec 7, 2022
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>Elden Ring was my first FromSoft game. I had heard about soulslike games before, but wasn't exactly sure what it was about. I had the impression the games were difficult and provided quite a lot of challenge.
When I bought Elden Ring I was prepared to die, a lot, while learning the mechanics. However it wasn't only the build variety and the funny combat situations I found myself in that were the cream of the crop. It was the atmosphere, the main story, the NPCs stories, the bosse's unique personalities and traits, the landscapes that stretched as far as the eye could see, the long and solitary rides with Torrent to places unknown (and way above my level).
Then, there were the caves, catacombs, tunnels, graves and all the underground areas that made for an intense sense of exploration, danger and reward. It progressively felt that the game was released with way too much, so much was the content to get into. The map was enormous, overwhelming, and I so much enjoyed it that I didn't want it to end.
In terms of replayability I prefered to go through smaller and contained legacy dungeons than going through the immense open areas and all the dungeons once more. I ended up repeating some in subsequent playthroughs.
All main bosses were memorable to me. Malenia was the most challenging boss I ever fought. After I beat her I went into co-op and helped others beating her too. It was such good fun finding a nice group and savouring our victory together!
To wrap things up, Elden Ring was not only the game of the year to me, but also one of the best games - if not the best game - I ever played. It was the game I needed to play, and it came exactly at the right time.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">
        Read More

      Xbox Series X

  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>Garbage trash only **** play this peice of this What a garbage of the year damn lol</span></div> <!----> <!----></div></div> <div class="c-siteReview_extra u-grid u-grid-gap-medium g-inner-spacing-medium o-border-thin-top g-border-gray30 c-siteReview_extra-user"><!----> <div class="c-siteReview_externalLink g-color-gray80 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter c-siteReview_flag"><svg class="g-outer-spacing-right-small"><use xlink:href="#flag"></use></svg> <span class="g-text-link u-text-underline-under u-text-uppercase">Report</span></div> <!----> <div class="c-siteReview_platform g-text-bold g-color-gray80 g-text-xsmall u-text-right u-text-uppercase">
      Xbox Series X
    </div></div></div> <!----> <!----></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 10 out of 10" aria-label="User score 10 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_green c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-gray90 c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">10</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/DieterU/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="DieterU">
    DieterU
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Nov 26, 2022
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>While I don't necessarily think this is FromSoftware's best game to date, this is easily the game I would recommend to play first for anyone wondering where to start in the series. It has immense challenge for players who are up for it; Malenia is easily the hardest boss in any Soulsborne game ever. But for newer players, the game provides many ways to make their playing experience more manageable. So for anyone looking to get into FromSoft games, this is the best place to start imo.

This game absolutely masters the art of the open world game like few have done before it. The only other open world games I've played that live up to the open world design of Elden Ring are Skyrim and Breath of the Wild. This was by far the most surprising thing about this game to me. FromSoft had always been known for their intricate 3D Metroidvania style games, so a fully realized and incredibly detailed open world game isn't what I was expecting from them. But it just works so well here. Also, their more narrow, non-linear, metroidvania style level design is still abundantly present in the NUMEROUS castles found throughout the map.

Bosses are good. Best storyline that FromSoft has delivered so far. Still very much leaning into that alternative form of storytelling where you need to think about the context of why certain enemies are where they are, and you need to look through item descriptions to understand the story.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

    Nov 14, 2022
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>[SPOILER ALERT: This review contains spoilers.]</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">
        Read More
      </span> <!----> <!----></button></div> <!----></div></div> <div class="c-siteReview_extra u-grid u-grid-gap-medium g-inner-spacing-medium o-border-thin-top g-border-gray30 c-siteReview_extra-user"><!----> <div class="c-siteReview_externalLink g-color-gray80 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter c-siteReview_flag"><svg class="g-outer-spacing-right-small"><use xlink:href="#flag"></use></svg> <span class="g-text-link u-text-underline-under u-text-uppercase">Report</span></div> <!----> <div class="c-siteReview_platform g-text-bold g-color-gray80 g-text-xsmall u-text-right u-text-uppercase">
      Xbox Series X
    </div></div></div> <!----> <!----></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 10 out of 10" aria-label="User score 10 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_green c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-gray90 c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">10</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/SirFlankBoring/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="SirFlankBoring">
    SirFlankBoring
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Nov 14, 2022
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>For disclaimer: I made 100% of the three games in the Souls franchise.

When I saw the trailer for Elden Ring, it was like I was witnessing Miyazaki's new challenge to the gaming industry. Since Demons Souls (2009) and Dark Souls (2011) went down in history as innovative and challenging games, the first thing to think about would be: "How will Elden Ring innovate?"... The answer came through the gameplay.

I never imagined that From Software would be able to create something so epic, mixing an amazing OST (made by Yuka Kitamura), a magical setting and such fantastic mechanics. Elden Ring gives me the same feeling as Skyrim, a feeling of a vast world to explore, with different possibilities, for me, these two games are like brothers, things that only appear from decade to decade in the gaming world.

The bosses never disappoint, no matter if it's a dungeon boss, or a main boss, their theme songs are amazing, and you really feel that the moment is a certain tension. The dubbing of the game is to be praised, all the voice actors managed to highlight the presence of their characters well, and this is something that I see little commented on.

There are different builds, for all tastes, for all the bosses you want, and this goes back to what I said before, Skyrim and Elden Ring are brothers, both games give you immense possibilities for gameplay, magic, archery, one hand, two hands, punch. You'll never run out of ideas for an NG+.

In short: Elden Ring is the kind of game you only see every decade, and it's been a real pleasure to write about this masterpiece by Miyazaki.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">
        Read More
      </span> <!----> <!----></button></div> <!----></div></div> <div class="c-siteReview_extra u-grid u-grid-gap-medium g-inner-spacing-medium o-border-thin-top g-border-gray30 c-siteReview_extra-user"><!----> <div class="c-siteReview_externalLink g-color-gray80 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter c-siteReview_flag"><svg class="g-outer-spacing-right-small"><use xlink:href="#flag"></use></svg> <span class="g-text-link u-text-underline-under u-text-uppercase">Report</span></div> <!----> <div class="c-siteReview_platform g-text-bold g-color-gray80 g-text-xsmall u-text-right u-text-uppercase">
      Xbox Series X
    </div></div></div> <!----> <!----></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 10 out of 10" aria-label="User score 10 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_green c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-gray90 c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">10</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/VeritasRampo/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="VeritasRampo">

      Xbox Series X
    </div></div></div> <!----> <div class="c-adMpu g-bg-gray10 u-block c-pageProductReviews_ad-mobile-spacing"><div class="c-adMpu_ad c-adDisplay_container c-adDisplay_container_incontent_boxad spaced blank"><div data-ad="incontent_boxad" data-instance="0" data-disable-initial-load="true" data-constraint="all" class="u-text-center c-adDisplay"></div></div></div></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 10 out of 10" aria-label="User score 10 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_green c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-gray90 c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">10</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/M4cul4d0/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="M4cul4d0">

  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>Melhor jogo q ja joguei na minha vida, simplesmente perfeito em todos os aspectos</span></div> <!----> <!----></div></div> <div class="c-siteReview_extra u-grid u-grid-gap-medium g-inner-spacing-medium o-border-thin-top g-border-gray30 c-siteReview_extra-user"><!----> <div class="c-siteReview_externalLink g-color-gray80 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter c-siteReview_flag"><svg class="g-outer-spacing-right-small"><use xlink:href="#flag"></use></svg> <span class="g-text-link u-text-underline-under u-text-uppercase">Report</span></div> <!----> <div class="c-siteReview_platform g-text-bold g-color-gray80 g-text-xsmall u-text-right u-text-uppercase">
      Xbox Series X

Combat is the only thing to do and it **** too, just hit, block, dodge repeat, it is slow and boring, there are some weapons that do a special type of attack like laser beam and such but they even managed to make those special weapon attacks slow and boring. Truly beautiful and immersive world with some of the best variety I have ever seen.</span></div> <!----> <!----></div></div> <div class="c-siteReview_extra u-grid u-grid-gap-medium g-inner-spacing-medium o-border-thin-top g-border-gray30 c-siteReview_extra-user"><!----> <div class="c-siteReview_externalLink g-color-gray80 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter c-siteReview_flag"><svg class="g-outer-spacing-right-small"><use xlink:href="#flag"></use></svg> <span class="g-text-link u-text-underline-under u-text-uppercase">Report</span></div> <!----> <div class="c-siteReview_platform g-text-bold g-color-gray80 g-text-xsmall u-text-right u-text-uppercase">
      Xbox Series X
    </div></div></div> <!----> <!----></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 10 out of 10" aria-label="User score 10 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_green c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-gray90 c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">10</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/Zetaboyao/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="Zetaboyao">
    Zetaboyao
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Nov 12, 2022
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>Ahora si... FINAL. (Aviso: ... MUCHO TEXTO ...) No se cuanto mas se pueda decir de ELDEN RING que no se haya dicho hasta el momento. Yo creo que este juego es una experiencia que puede llevarse de diferentes maneras y creo que es super recomendable sobre todo al publico que disfruta de desafíos, de mundos abiertos y de maravillarse con lo que tranquilamente podría ser una de las mejores OST de la historia. ELDEN RING para mi es GOTY pero NO ES PERFECTO. Tanto el mundo como la duración son extensos sin entenderse realmente la finalidad del mismo .El sistema de crafteo, se usa muy poco y no es para nada relevante. Hay muchos enemigos repetidos, de igual manera que zonas... etc... NO ES PERFECTO.
Sin embargo hasta el final no deja de maravillarte. Si de a poco logras ir siguiendo la historia, si ademas buscas afuera, en youtube o el canal que mas te guste, el entendimiento del mundo, si te aferras a ciertas Questlines y las llevas hasta el final, es maravilloso desde el punto narrativo.
La inmersion que se encuentra a traves del arte y la musica es increible.
El combate por supuesto es desafiante, y el agregado de las invocaciones lo hace mucho mas accesible que sus predecesores.
El juego en si a veces se ameseta pero en sus picos mas altos es una OBRA MAESTRA SOBRESALIENTE.
Jugandolo tranqui **** 8 meses en terminarlo mas o menos. Podes dejar y volver a las Tierras intermedias si estas cansado. Es por este ritmo que aunque sea un juego CARO... me parece super rentable por la cantidad de horas que se le puede dedicar sin inferir en conseguir todos los logros o probar diferentes runs con diferentes builds inclusive.
En fin... ELDEN RING... SI!</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>The best Dark Souls style game. From Soft absolutely annihlates every single open world game every made(besides outerwilds and botw). Instead of cluttering you ADHD ridden brain will waypoints and objecitve markers found by climbing a ubisoft tower, elden ring actively hides its content in obscure places that prompt you to actually explore the map. The map itself is iconic and memorable. Most regions in the map are easily recognizable and enjoyable to explore. The combat is as refined as single player combat can become. Elden ring is almost like a competitive single player game in terms of how it makes you feel while playing. My only complaint is that the game is so long, I got burnt out around 50 hours in, and I beat it after about 80 hours.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>It has been over 7 years since I have been able to actually sit down with a game and forget real life for the moment I am playing.

This game did that for me.

First time playing it I played for 13 hours before I noticed rays of light coming from the sunrise outside my home - this was on a Tuesday night. Went to uni feeling like I was living in a fever dream, planning what my next move in the game would be. I was as hooked as one can be.

Absolutely amazing game design and attention to detail. My first soulslike game, but a very good place to start. Objectively game of the year.

Only downside is the occasional frame drops - which, after some research, seems like a relatively usual issue with Fromsoftware games.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

    GrilledMackrel
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Sep 5, 2022
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>This game can prove that you can definitely have too much **** thing. To say the map is big is a massive understatement. The verticality of the game world on top of the area size is absolute overkill. I haven't even reached the Capital yet and I feel. Burnt. Out. I'm so mixed on it. I love the world design but it does feel somewhat endless and a bit hollow? I do feel like tye enemies have more predictable attack patterns but the variety is there until you start to notice a somewhat shameless reuse of assets. This game has 165 Bosses! I think dark souls 2 only had 40 or so? I wish I could appreciate this game more and I respect the effort put into it. But somehow. Its too much for me personally. Which is weird. Maybe they should change the multiplayer mechanics so that you can interact with players in real time with no summon signs. Instead of summons it could end up being alot more organic. I'm sure covenants could still be implemented in some form or fashion. I just think if you're going to have such a large open world. You may as well make it more social. It would feel alot less empty I suppose as a result.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

This was my first from software game and i can safely say that i will be playing the others after this.</span></div> <!----> <!----></div></div> <div class="c-siteReview_extra u-grid u-grid-gap-medium g-inner-spacing-medium o-border-thin-top g-border-gray30 c-siteReview_extra-user"><!----> <div class="c-siteReview_externalLink g-color-gray80 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter c-siteReview_flag"><svg class="g-outer-spacing-right-small"><use xlink:href="#flag"></use></svg> <span class="g-text-link u-text-underline-under u-text-uppercase">Report</span></div> <!----> <div class="c-siteReview_platform g-text-bold g-color-gray80 g-text-xsmall u-text-right u-text-uppercase">
      Xbox Series X
    </div></div></div> <!----> <!----></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 10 out of 10" aria-label="User score 10 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_green c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-gray90 c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">10</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/CCLuminosity/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="CCLuminosity">

  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Aug 4, 2022
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>Wer Dark Souls liebt wird Elden Ring vergöttern.

Die Spielwelt ist offen und gnadenlos.
Dein Drang etwas zu entdecken bestimmt ein Stück weit deinen Spielspaß.
Ich liebe es in dieser Welt zu spazieren und jeden Winkel zu erkunden.
Es gibt so viele versteckte Details und Orte.

Monster und Bosse sind wie gewohnt hart und bedingungslos.
Den Gegner beobachten und geschickt vorgehen ist die Lösung der Probleme.
Aber dabei niemals vergessen: nicht zu gierig werden!

Ich liebe dieses Spiel und kann es nur weiter empfehlen.
Dieses Spiel ist definitiv eine Pflicht für jeden der extrem gute Vertonung, Story/ Lore, Vielfalt, eine extreme Herausforderung  und Liebe zum Detail sucht.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

    </div></div></div> <!----> <!----></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 0 out of 10" aria-label="User score 0 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_red c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-white c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">0</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/Sand_Sand/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="Sand_Sand">
    Sand_Sand
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Aug 3, 2022
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>ss23 says it perfectly

(With Elden Ring, Fromsoft proves it has finally lost sight of what makes their games fair and rewarding and has caved in completely to artificial difficulty. Fights in this game are either trivial or littered with poorly thought out fast attacks and combos, with dramatic AOE effects in bossrooms to cover up the horrible design choices. The gameplay has barely changed since DS3 and does not equip the player with the appropriate toolset to handle its range of enemies. Even worse, they have somehow regressed in quality, with slower rolls, less i frames, input buffering, input delay, inputs disappearing. The damage done in the last third of the game is so bizarre that I cannot even begin to comprehend the thought process. It feels like From really wanted to make an open world game, designed a huge and interconnecting map, and everything else just played second fiddle: littering the landscape with uncreative, sparse and repeated dungeons and encounters, scrapping together unused boss and enemy designs from previous games and slapping it together without thorough playtesting or thoughtful user-oriented design. In summary, after several hundred hours of From games, this is the game that has now tarnished my image of From as a company that holds their games to high standards and respects the player.)

i cant say it better.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>One of the worst open world games I've played.  The graphics are dated and uninspired.  Constant FPS issues even on console.  The publishers boasted that they consulted George R.R.  Martin for the story.  There is no story.  This game is a soul-less mess where players will constantly have to look up guides just to find out how to finish "quests".  Game difficulty is artificially too difficult in some parts with stupid gimmicks.  Boss fights are boring and repetitive.  The UI is horrible and many of the stats (for a stat based game) are not shown in game.  This is another game where the reviewers and various streamers are paid shills.     Jul 26, 2022
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>The game is good, but it fails with certain bosses. Either they're repetitive or unbalanced (AOE spamming fest). But for a Skyrim sized open world soulslike, it's definitely worth a try.</span></div> <!----> <!----></div></div> <div class="c-siteReview_extra u-grid u-grid-gap-medium g-inner-spacing-medium o-border-thin-top g-border-gray30 c-siteReview_extra-user"><!----> <div class="c-siteReview_externalLink g-color-gray80 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter c-siteReview_flag"><svg class="g-outer-spacing-right-small"><use xlink:href="#flag"></use></svg> <span class="g-text-link u-text-underline-under u-text-uppercase">Report</span></div> <!----> <div class="c-siteReview_platform g-text-bold g-color-gray80 g-text-xsmall u-text-right u-text-uppercase">
      Xbox Series X
    </div></div></div> <!----> <!----></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 7 out of 10" aria-label="User score 7 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_yellow c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-gray90 c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">7</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/123579/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="123579">
    123579
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Jul 26, 2022
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>It's an okay game. Dare I say, even good. But it's not the second coming of christ that a lot of people are making it out to be.

I just played Sekiro, and damn, that game is incredible. It's challenging, with a great story, and visceral combat. Which is everything this game isn't, so going from that to this was just jarring.

Combat in this game consists of rolling around like runaway tire while bosses spam attacks, and then occasionally getting a smack or two in. The fact that defense still consists of the same crap dark souls had 10 years ago is lame. All an agility character can do is roll around like a moron. Why didn't they at least try and put sekiro's parry in? Why isn't there a smaller step dodge that's actually useful? All you can do is roll 5 times in a row, then get one hit in.

The story is, well, vague. Meh. That's all I have to say. Coming from Sekiro's story to this was disappointing.

In past souls type games by Fromsoft, you'd adventure a while, and encounter a boss, and get stuck on it a long time then finally have that "hell yeah" moment when you beat it. Just coming from Sekiro, each boss was exhilarating. Overcoming boss enemies in this game **** ass. Why? The density. Everywhere you throw a stone there's a goddamn boss. It's so tedious. There's no pacing, it's all just boss enemies everywhere all over the world that you'll die to 5+ times, and then actual turbo bosses that you'll die on 30+ times in the dungeon areas.

There's another issue with combat. In the open world, fighting on the horse is optimal nearly all the time. Like 99% of the time. In a game where death is so punishing, it would be stupid to not do the most optimal thing. It's also optimal to just run past and completely ignore the existence of a lot of enemies. The reward for killing them just isn't worth the time. Who the hell designs a game where you're just supposed to bypass things people put weeks of work into designing?

The open world is good I guess, if a bit monochromatic, with a few exception areas that are incredible to behold. Some areas are really fun to explore. Some are awful and incredibly aggravating. Fast travel is a thing. A big thing. There are bonfires every 10 feet. And you'll be fast traveling between them all the time because of the tedium factor involved. I really dislike fast travel like this but whatever.

Overall I'd just call this game amazing, annoying, tedious, and fun, all at the same time. It's definitely not a 10/10. It's dark souls with a bigger (and less good, in my opinion) world. It'll give you a good 150, 200 hours of playtime. I really wish they at least tried to innovate on the crappy and dated dark souls combat, instead of making us roll more than a stoner in a joint factory.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">
        Read More

  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>I'm a 41-year-old married life-long gamer with limited gaming time. Still, I play all sorts of games, have several subscription services - always looking for that next masterpiece ****. I rarely come across masterpieces nowadays and I've completed very few action or RPG games the last decade. And then came Elden Ring. Elden Ring is a masterpiece. I just finished putting just over 200 hours into my first playthrough, during which I searched every nook and cranny, tried to fight every enemy and boss, tried to find every item, tried to finish every quest, and accomplished most of that. A masterpiece. Beautiful. It's a modern and mature Zelda, a new gen and darker Skyrim with greater difficulty and less time-consuming and useless systems. It's grand. It's art. And I recommend it to every gamer. If you can get over the difficulty, you will be rewarded. And I never liked Souls-type games one bit before ER, but I see dopeness and beauty even in death in Elden Ring - how cool the enemy looks as he stalks over your body, the environment, the graphics and grandeur of it all. A masterpiece. Bravo, FromSoftware.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

    Ottalaus_saus
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Jul 6, 2022
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>It sure is a great game, and anyone hating the game for it's difficulty has played too many ubisoft games. The issue is this is an open world dark souls game. Yes the visuals look better and you have a horse! But there's is no difference from ds3. After playing dark souls I thought elden ring would be different but the whole gameplay system, sounds, controls, movement and everything is reused from dark souls 3, and I'm burnt out on that. It's the reason they made this huge game so quickly. Still though, I'm 60 hours in and I'd recommend it. It's the same old dark souls that we all love, but I would only wish for some more innovation.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">
        Read More

    ReeceG
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Jun 23, 2022
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>Is a newcomer to the souls franchise, I can safely say that Elden Ring is the perfect balance between difficulty and fun. The combat feels fluid, satisfying, and fair. Never was there a point during my 100 hours in the game so far where I had felt completely defeated; I was always improving learning the moves of bosses and standard enemies alike.

A challenge was not the only thing Elden Ring brings to the table, it also features a vast open world that is constantly rewarding the player for exploring. There are an absurd amount of weapons, talismans, sorceries, and incantations to be found; and just as many unique variants of said gear that feel different.

I played Elden Ring on my Xbox One S and the graphics absolutely still hold up a generation behind. In my entire Elden Ring experience the game only stuttered a few times when certain open world weather effects were active. I imagine that this wouldn’t be a problem on current Gen, and even so it wasn’t inconvenient enough to take away from what I’d consider to be a perfect game.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

    onil
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Jun 16, 2022
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>The open world is amazing, there is so much detail to this game. But I can’t really call Elden Ring a game, because games are fun. Elden Ring is not fun. Its very simple why it is terrible.
Elden Ring punishes you in more ways than just charging you $70, by giving you re-used Bosses, lots of dead ends, terrible game logic, zero fun, and a broken controller. Its mainly the terrible boss design, I get killed at full health in two hits while taking 30 minutes to recover from the last attack! And to just arrive at the boss fight, you have to deal with a plethora of nuisances that deal unreasonable amounts of damage. And by late game, you can only really level up your character and weapons by killing the bosses that kill you in less that 10 seconds. What really aggravated me and lots of other Elden Ring players was the Godskin Duo, the most annoying boss in the entire game. They are near impossible to fight without dying immediately. I know Elden Ring has one of the largest and most detailed maps, good graphics, and is a great challenge, but it all comes down to how much fun and joy you can have. There is no fun and joy in this. Zero. It is mentally draining to play. You should only buy Elden Ring if you an absurd amount of time on your hands and if you hate yourself.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>This game is a steaming pile of garbage. how it got 10 out of 10 across the entire critical spectrum is beyond my comprehension.  It fails all three metrics I consider important for judging the quality ****, which are Gameplay, Story, and Graphics.

The gameplay is just your standard Dark Souls gameplay with the added feature of a jump button. The story is told so indirectly it might as well be non-existent. and graphically it's seriously outdated.

I swear the developer must have paid off the critics to give them 10 out of 10 across the board. This is not a 10 out of 10 game. I probably would have been more generous in my review if the reviews of this game were honest. It's at best a 7 out of 10 game. But the hype surrounding this game has made the critics and whole gaming community lose their collective minds. Don't drink the Cool-aid. This game is not nearly as good as people want you to believe it is.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>After fully completing the game and putting in 140 hours, I think the critics nailed it, this game really is an open world masterpiece which is guaranteed to influence open world rpgs and maybe even open world shooters moving forward. The artistic, design, sound, exploration, immersion, combat, lore, enemy/area/boss/weapon/spell variety and size of the world are literally off the charts. It's also challenging while not being unfair and it gives you options to trivialise absolutely anything if you have no interest in the challenge. If they had charged $100 (EA or Ubisoft would have) it would be understandable but at 60 it's a steal.   </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>This might be my favorite game of all time. It is a breath of fresh air from the other souls-like games.       Xbox Series X
    </div></div></div> <!----> <!----></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 10 out of 10" aria-label="User score 10 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_green c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-gray90 c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">10</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/Chastizer/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="Chastizer">
    Chastizer
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    May 22, 2022
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>It always seems like some of the greatest games I have ever played always sneak up on me. I've played all 3 Dark Souls games, and while I liked them, I never really considered myself a fan. I knew that this game was on the horizon for a while, but my excitement for it didn't begin until about a week before it dropped, and when it did it was like the worlds worst itch meeting a backscratcher.

Elden Ring is functionally the same as any of the Dark Souls games, albeit with From Software's approach on an open world. I was curious going in how the very clever world and level design from previous games would be affected by this, and I'm happy to say they nailed it. The open parts of the map are filled with areas that naturally peak curiosity and reward it with interesting events, good environmental story telling, or sometimes even just a beautiful vista. Pair that with more sectioned off areas that have a more traditional From Software level design and you have what, in my opinion, is the best of both worlds. Combat, like the Dark Souls games is solid, and while it may seem difficult at first, this game is better than it's predecessors at easing you into it. Leveling up and character building is a little obtuse like the other games, with little to guide you aside from finding a weapon you think is neat, but I feel like figuring things out like that is a bit of the fun in these types of games.

That being said, as great a game as it is, nothing is without criticism. However in the grand scheme of what this game has to offer, I would say this is more nitpicking than anything. First of all, as with all From Software game I have played thus far, the multiplayer still feels a little obtuse and at times confusing to use. Myself and a lot of my friends were at different points in the story at different times, and not knowing where and where they could not be summoned in a world as open and with as much stuff to do as this one was frustrating. I didn't realize until 60 hours in that you can't summon someone in an area that you have already defeated the boss in, why not? Second is more a personal gripe than it is anything, but I played an Int/Dex build (original I know). My other friends that played with Arcane and Wisdom builds were throwing fire from their hands, summoning dragon heads to breathe damaging elements at things, and summoning lighting to smite their enemies. Meanwhile with my intelligence build I had... 10 different types of the same glintstone shard to fire. I ended up liking my build don't get me wrong, but I wish that intelligence builds had the same variety. Lastly, I wish that the smaller dungeons that veered off in the open world sections had a little bit more variety. I liked the ones I did, but by the last bit of the game I just stopped doing them all together because by that point I had my fill of caves, mines, and crypts.

All in all, Elden Ring is phenomenal. Easily one of the best action rpgs I have ever played.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">
        Read More

Cons:, Late game difficulty spike that makes you feel like your back at Level 1(And I've beaten Dark souls 1), All of a sudden past the 35 hour mark Bosses suddenly take years to kill because of there high health pool, they have stupid fast attacks which is not a problem by itself, but those fast attacks hit for your entire health bar, what should be like is that Fast and hard to dodge attacks should hit for a little less, while easier to dodge attacks should hit for much more like it was in ds1. But the reason I don't give this game a lower score is because all these issues can be fixed by one guy with a slider tool. Just tweak some of the enemy health and damage. "But so what? Far Cry games are huge and it doesn't make them good." Except this....this is how it's done.     jamezgower
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    May 3, 2022
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>Elden Ring is a colossal game that involves fantastic combat encounters across the expansive world of the Lands Between. This game has at least 100 hours of rewarding and exciting content on a first play through. The open world is refreshing and stands out amongst the crowd of mediocre Ubisoft games. The world is densely populated with challenging bosses, dungeons and fascinating characters and quest lines. Customization is fantastic, you can select from many builds such as a glass cannon mage, a tanky knight or an adept bandit and that can be changed and reformed throughout the game. Elden Ring is the first FROM SOFTWARE game that I have played and it is excellent for beginners of the Souls sub-genre of games. There is lots of mechanics that make this game easier for newcomers but they can also be ignored if you want a greater challenge. This game is quite difficult but it rarely becomes grindy and repetitive. This game builds on the open world foundation left by Breath of The Wild and manages to be one of the most memorable, challenging and fun games I have ever played.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>Yet another repetitive entry in the most overrated franchise in the history of mankind. Do you enjoy clunky, garbage combat with backwards controls, tons of unoriginal enemies, boss and minion alike, praised by the bird brained who seek validation in getting "gud" but if animations had any accuracy - would be insta-killed every dodge? Don't worry, those massive monsters usually die by attacking their feet in between the five minutes it takes for them to even attempt to stomp you. Do you enjoy the most empty world full of useless items with deep empty names, unintuitive crafting and boring levelling? You prefer your UI to look like Paint developed assets, a map that looks like a coffee-spilled archeological wastebin bag and your cutscenes to be **** since every NPC is supposedly great by speaking slow, utterly nonsensical lines? Better dodge roll spam away from any Fromsoftware product and every mentally deficient idiot that praises these pure garbage games.     BeagleBoyGaming
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Apr 28, 2022
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>Elden Ring is a superb experience, bringing From Soft's Dark Souls combat to a new level and open world. Easily the most accessible Souls game with hard but fair game play that rewards the user. The bosses are fun for the most part and the open world always has somthing to find and lack the soullessness of modern open world games. No game is perfect and Elden Ring has a few quibbles, such as some of the bosses being a little too big for the camera to see and the lock on system is flawed. However a 10/10 is not saying a game is perfect and I can give this game no less then that. One of the best games i have ever played neck and neck with Fallout New Vegas for my favorite open world game.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Apr 24, 2022
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>An uphill fight and can be super frustrating, but when you finally push through, its the best feeling in the world. the distilled essence of Dark Souls. a must play.</span></div> <!----> <!----></div></div> <div class="c-siteReview_extra u-grid u-grid-gap-medium g-inner-spacing-medium o-border-thin-top g-border-gray30 c-siteReview_extra-user"><!----> <div class="c-siteReview_externalLink g-color-gray80 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter c-siteReview_flag"><svg class="g-outer-spacing-right-small"><use xlink:href="#flag"></use></svg> <span class="g-text-link u-text-underline-under u-text-uppercase">Report</span></div> <!----> <div class="c-siteReview_platform g-text-bold g-color-gray80 g-text-xsmall u-text-right u-text-uppercase">
      Xbox Series X
    </div></div></div> <!----> <!----></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 10 out of 10" aria-label="User score 10 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_green c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-gray90 c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">10</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/Myboi/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="Myboi">
    Myboi
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Apr 24, 2022
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>Elden Ring is a masterpiece and possibly my favorite game of all time, let me explain why. First of all, the gameplay. It is a hybrid of dark souls 3's combat system and general movement combined with aspects of Sekiro's mobility, such as jumping and stealth. In my opinion, it works perfectly well, combining methodical and agressive mechanicals into one. Secondly, the atmosphere and the open world. It truly is one of the most immersive games I've ever played. It's a beautiful game filled with diverse landscapes and beautiful music. Every area feels like your walking into a living, breathing painting. Next, the story in this game. It's fantastically vague and fleshed out, much like it's predecessors. The story itself is interesting and captivating, perhaps the best in the entire series. Now for the npcs and side quests. Almost every npc character in this game has a quest line. These are almost always amazing and generate a connection between the npc and the player. The problem of finding the npc in a hidden location is mostly gone now that a character marker has been added, although not completely. Finally, the cinematic and fantastic boss fights. My favorite part of all the souls games have always been the boss fights, duels with mythical knights and gigantic beasts are almost always done so well in the souls series. Elden Ring is no exception. So many bosses in this game are amazing! These aspects of the game add up to elden ring being a masterpiece. However, it's not perfect, nowhere near it.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

      Xbox Series X
    </div></div></div> <!----> <!----></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 0 out of 10" aria-label="User score 0 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_red c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-white c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">0</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/010101010100/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="010101010100">
    010101010100
