    GriffinJ
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Apr 24, 2022
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>This easily became top 3 of my favorites games, the absolutely phenomenal story, the insane boss fights, good, fluid, controls. FromSoft put an absolute **** load of work into it, and you can tell. Absolutely perfect, one of the only games I've 100%. 10/10 will be playing through again.</span></div> <!----> <!----></div></div> <div class="c-siteReview_extra u-grid u-grid-gap-medium g-inner-spacing-medium o-border-thin-top g-border-gray30 c-siteReview_extra-user"><!----> <div class="c-siteReview_externalLink g-color-gray80 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter c-siteReview_flag"><svg class="g-outer-spacing-right-small"><use xlink:href="#flag"></use></svg> <span class="g-text-link u-text-underline-under u-text-uppercase">Report</span></div> <!----> <div class="c-siteReview_platform g-text-bold g-color-gray80 g-text-xsmall u-text-right u-text-uppercase">
      Xbox Series X
    </div></div></div> <!----> <!----></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 6 out of 10" aria-label="User score 6 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_yellow c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-gray90 c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">6</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/defiance_of_one/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="defiance_of_one">
    defiance_of_one
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Apr 23, 2022
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>Pros- A massive open environment with nooks and crannies galore. The freedom to build your character the way you want, and respec (once you reach a certain point in the game) when you want to try a different play style are nice options to have. There is loot and weapons and armor galore, several different spirit ashes to find and use, which are essentially NPC's that you summon to help you in battle, and numerous different talismans which give you boosts to different abilities and stats. The freedom to truly mold you character into the type of fighter you want them to be is superb. The gameplay is mostly solid, and teaming up with a friend in co-op is a whole lot of fun. The game is gorgeous and the world is very immersive at times. The ability to sort of create your own stories within the game and talk about it with your friends is a highlight for sure. I'll never forget discussing strategies for certain areas and bosses with a couple of my friends that also play the game. Cons- Terrible camera angles at times. I don't know how many times I can legit blame dying on awful angles while fighting enemies in confined areas simply because I couldn't see them due to the camera positions. The targeting system when there are multiple enemies gets frustrating, and as fun as co-op is, they make it way too complicated to summon a friend. It seems ridiculous that I have to go farm plants to craft the items I need just to play cooperatively. Let me send them an invite and roam the Lands Between at will. I don't like that Torrent cannot be used at all during co-op either. It makes traversing the vast open world with friends seem more like a task than a good time. Story... Yeah. I just don't find it interesting. Not only is it really vague, but it is also bland and essentially non-existent at most times. There isn't much to keep me going other than the thrill of the next kill and a desire to explore. The NPC's are all stoic and dull, and lack personality. You feel no connection to anyone in the game. As far as RPG's go, this is at the bottom of the list in that aspect. I also dislike the total lack of hubs. No populated areas, whatsoever. Not one single town or city with any signs of life. That is more of a personal preference than a knock on the game, because that is obviously intentional to leave this type of thing out, but still- It makes the huge open world seem very bleak, lifeless, and empty. Several bosses are repeated, as are dungeons (outside of legacy dungeons and the main bosses) and that also eventually begins detracting from the overall experience. All in all, it's solid. I have plenty of gripes and opinions on what I think would make it a much better game, but that is all subjective, personal preference. If you are a fan of Souls games, you will most likely love this one. If you are used to open worlds such as The Elder Scrolls, Witcher 3, GTA, Red Dead, etc... You may feel like I do.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">
        Read More
      </span> <!----> <!----></button></div> <!----></div></div> <div class="c-siteReview_extra u-grid u-grid-gap-medium g-inner-spacing-medium o-border-thin-top g-border-gray30 c-siteReview_extra-user"><!----> <div class="c-siteReview_externalLink g-color-gray80 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter c-siteReview_flag"><svg class="g-outer-spacing-right-small"><use xlink:href="#flag"></use></svg> <span class="g-text-link u-text-underline-under u-text-uppercase">Report</span></div> <!----> <div class="c-siteReview_platform g-text-bold g-color-gray80 g-text-xsmall u-text-right u-text-uppercase">
      Xbox Series X
    </div></div></div> <!----> <div class="c-adMpu g-bg-gray10 u-block c-pageProductReviews_ad-mobile-spacing"><div class="c-adMpu_ad c-adDisplay_container c-adDisplay_container_incontent_boxad spaced blank"><div data-ad="incontent_boxad" data-instance="0" data-disable-initial-load="true" data-constraint="all" class="u-text-center c-adDisplay"></div></div></div></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 10 out of 10" aria-label="User score 10 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_green c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-gray90 c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">10</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/Up2L8/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="Up2L8">
    Up2L8
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Apr 22, 2022
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>I was initially a bit intimidated into the onboarding of this game (from attempting a souls game) but got **** in from the high scores on reviews. I felt like by NOT playing this, I would possibly be missing out on a game of the year candidate.  The game is absolutely deserving of it's high marks and I'm blown away about how much I actually enjoy this game.

The first couple of hours were a bit daunting and I started to wonder what I got my self into.  It felt like "Well here comes another game I shouldn't have bought".  But I pushed through to learn the mechanics and how the game wanted me to play and at this point, every time I turn on the Series X, its the first thing I click on.  The world is highly satisfying to explore. The graphics look great on an OLED (Not sure what others have issues with, it definitely looks like a next gen game).  The game is challenging which isn't easy to come by these days, but remains rewarding.  The gear/progression system is addicting and I believe the game has very long legs as something you play off and on for the entire year.

I'm a shooter/sports/sometimes RPG fan.  This game should not be in my wheelhouse.  But the hooks are in deep and at this point I couldn't be happier I decided to check this out. FromSoftware is now a "must check out" their new game developer for me alongside studios like Bethesda.

Do yourself a favor, stop contimplating it.  Stop getting stuck on people throwing hate because they don't enjoy the challenge.  It's a game that doesn't hold your hand and that's rare right now and should be praised.  We come to video games for escape and emergence.  It's ****'s Elden Ring.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

    Pzoli
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Apr 22, 2022
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>I am not the type of person writing a lot of reviews, but in this case I believ it is an obligation to warn those players out there that this game is definitely not for everyone.
I bought the game for a lot of money and expected a huge challenge, as I knew about the difficulty of souls games. I was prepared. I thought.
After 19 hours I decided to get rid off the most frustrating gaming experience I have ever experienced from my consol and deleted the game. Not one minute did I feel any kind of fun spending with this game. In my opinion it is completely unfair and thus annoying.
Furthermore there is basically 0 story. Vague storytelling? No. It is no storytelling. Terrible.
Beautiful graphics? I would not consider it such. Often times I was not even able to realize there is an NPC next to me, because it disolved into the background.
Music? When my 6 year old son without watching, just listening to what I am doing points out how terrible the music of the game is, I realize why my frustration spending with this title is so big.
I honestly do not understand the extremely high critics reviews, why they call this game a milestone. Maybe for a niche group of players who like to be annoyed and frustrated by a game, it delivers, but I did not have fun with it for any second.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

IT was only made hard to cover up the fact that it would take 2 hours to beat on easy mode.</span></div> <!----> <!----></div></div> <div class="c-siteReview_extra u-grid u-grid-gap-medium g-inner-spacing-medium o-border-thin-top g-border-gray30 c-siteReview_extra-user"><!----> <div class="c-siteReview_externalLink g-color-gray80 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter c-siteReview_flag"><svg class="g-outer-spacing-right-small"><use xlink:href="#flag"></use></svg> <span class="g-text-link u-text-underline-under u-text-uppercase">Report</span></div> <!----> <div class="c-siteReview_platform g-text-bold g-color-gray80 g-text-xsmall u-text-right u-text-uppercase">

    Bluedragonakira
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Apr 19, 2022
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>Elden Ring is the pinnacle of gaming. A masterpiece of gaming. In a era of “Please hold my hand daddy” games, with screens littered with go here, do this icons all over the place, Elden Ring throws you in a world and says nothing because it’s your journey to make, survive, craft, loot gear, take in the scenery, run away from hard enemies. Every inch of the map is explorable and serves a purpose. The boss fights are intense and satisfying. Keep in mind while other developers have been updating their engines, this is still the same engine that brought us Demon Souls way back when. There’s a lot more to be said about Elden Ring but I’ll let you figure it out on your own. This last message is for a certain group of people, Stop asking for a easy mode.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

    Goodseek
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Apr 18, 2022
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>There is no such thing as perfection but if I could score it 9.9 that would be more accurate.

After 160hrs in my first playthrough Elden Ring has become my favorite game ever, as for the performance issues that some of the reviews mention, I played the game on quality mode on Xbox series X without V-sync or any fancy monitors and I didn't notice any frame drops, to be fair I started gaming in the 90's when 30fps was only a dream.

Visuals: 9.9/10 (not realistic but jaw dropping and with a few glitches)

Music and sound design: 10/10 (perfect balance between chilling exploration and intense masterpieces on boss battles)

Story: 9.0/10 (hard to put everything together but worth it with an amazing lore)

The open world: 10/10 (massive, rich with landmarks and filled with tons of challenging enemies and bosses)

Gameplay: 9.5/10 (The very best of past from software games with a ton of additions to improve it, but it's lacking an in game journal to remove the need of so many online guides)

A masterpiece that will undoubtedly become a classic for the ages and a must play for any serious gamer.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>This game gives me anxiety. People think it's a classic, personally it's the least amount of fun I've had playing a game. It was torture.</span></div> <!----> <!----></div></div> <div class="c-siteReview_extra u-grid u-grid-gap-medium g-inner-spacing-medium o-border-thin-top g-border-gray30 c-siteReview_extra-user"><!----> <div class="c-siteReview_externalLink g-color-gray80 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter c-siteReview_flag"><svg class="g-outer-spacing-right-small"><use xlink:href="#flag"></use></svg> <span class="g-text-link u-text-underline-under u-text-uppercase">Report</span></div> <!----> <div class="c-siteReview_platform g-text-bold g-color-gray80 g-text-xsmall u-text-right u-text-uppercase">
      Xbox Series X
    </div></div></div> <!----> <!----></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 4 out of 10" aria-label="User score 4 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_red c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-white c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">4</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/ss23/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="ss23">
    ss23
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Apr 17, 2022
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>First of all, let me preface by saying that it is never acceptable to knowingly release software that clearly cannot perform its main function reliably. Why should this be any different with Elden Ring's frame stutters? It has been a month and a half without any real fixes. I do not recall the same level of compassion with Cyberpunk.

With Elden Ring, Fromsoft proves it has finally lost sight of what makes their games fair and rewarding and has caved in completely to artificial difficulty. Fights in this game are either trivial or littered with poorly thought out fast attacks and combos, with dramatic AOE effects in bossrooms to cover up the horrible design choices. The gameplay has barely changed since DS3 and does not equip the player with the appropriate toolset to handle its range of enemies. Even worse, they have somehow regressed in quality, with slower rolls, less i frames, input buffering, input delay, inputs disappearing. The damage done in the last third of the game is so bizarre that I cannot even begin to comprehend the thought process. It feels like From really wanted to make an open world game, designed a huge and interconnecting map, and everything else just played second fiddle: littering the landscape with uncreative, sparse and repeated dungeons and encounters, scrapping together unused boss and enemy designs from previous games and slapping it together without thorough playtesting or thoughtful user-oriented design. In summary, after several hundred hours of From games, this is the game that has now tarnished my image of From as a company that holds their games to high standards and respects the player.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">
        Read More
      </span> <!----> <!----></button></div> <!----></div></div> <div class="c-siteReview_extra u-grid u-grid-gap-medium g-inner-spacing-medium o-border-thin-top g-border-gray30 c-siteReview_extra-user"><!----> <div class="c-siteReview_externalLink g-color-gray80 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter c-siteReview_flag"><svg class="g-outer-spacing-right-small"><use xlink:href="#flag"></use></svg> <span class="g-text-link u-text-underline-under u-text-uppercase">Report</span></div> <!----> <div class="c-siteReview_platform g-text-bold g-color-gray80 g-text-xsmall u-text-right u-text-uppercase">
      Xbox Series X
    </div></div></div> <!----> <!----></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 10 out of 10" aria-label="User score 10 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_green c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-gray90 c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">10</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/tgk333/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="tgk333">

    Apr 15, 2022
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>Never had a single problem, glitch, bug, or stuttering frames, outside what would be expected from any other game.

Frames aren't the highest, but it is consistent.</span></div> <!----> <!----></div></div> <div class="c-siteReview_extra u-grid u-grid-gap-medium g-inner-spacing-medium o-border-thin-top g-border-gray30 c-siteReview_extra-user"><!----> <div class="c-siteReview_externalLink g-color-gray80 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter c-siteReview_flag"><svg class="g-outer-spacing-right-small"><use xlink:href="#flag"></use></svg> <span class="g-text-link u-text-underline-under u-text-uppercase">Report</span></div> <!----> <div class="c-siteReview_platform g-text-bold g-color-gray80 g-text-xsmall u-text-right u-text-uppercase">
      Xbox Series X
    </div></div></div> <!----> <!----></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 10 out of 10" aria-label="User score 10 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_green c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-gray90 c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">10</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/UbiMonkey/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="UbiMonkey">
    UbiMonkey
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">

    BenFauWriter
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Apr 11, 2022
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>Don't expect an open world full of things, this is a soul game, so you'll die a lot and the "open world" will be full of tough monsters/knights to farm in order to level up. Unfortunately, you'll have to rely on guides to find what to do at the beginning. The game is good, but certainly not goty! Graphics are disappointing for ps5/xbox series x, there's a lot of bugs. Gameplay is archaic. Fan of the Souls serie will love it, but again isn't for everyone and is certainly not as good as all the reviews says.</span></div> <!----> <!----></div></div> <div class="c-siteReview_extra u-grid u-grid-gap-medium g-inner-spacing-medium o-border-thin-top g-border-gray30 c-siteReview_extra-user"><!----> <div class="c-siteReview_externalLink g-color-gray80 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter c-siteReview_flag"><svg class="g-outer-spacing-right-small"><use xlink:href="#flag"></use></svg> <span class="g-text-link u-text-underline-under u-text-uppercase">Report</span></div> <!----> <div class="c-siteReview_platform g-text-bold g-color-gray80 g-text-xsmall u-text-right u-text-uppercase">
      Xbox Series X
    </div></div></div> <!----> <!----></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 10 out of 10" aria-label="User score 10 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_green c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-gray90 c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">10</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/Filmanwalt/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="Filmanwalt">
    Filmanwalt
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Apr 11, 2022
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>I freaking LOVE this Game. Its phenomenal and everything I wanted from Fromsoft. For a more in depth Review you can use my backlogged link: ****/u/filmanwalt/reviews/

A little Sneak:
gameplay

The heart at the end.

a) Territories

I could rave all day about the diversity of the individual areas. There is so much to explore. Caelid, decomposed by rot, Limgrave as an open landscape with many castles and towers, Liurnia with a grandiose academy or the beautiful city of Leyndell. This is just part of the many areas to explore. The areas are a big part of the incessantly generating motivation.

It's unbelievable that Fromsoft managed to establish their level structure, the clear recognition value even in an open world that is so big. Despite the new world, you always feel at home and always try to compare some sections, places, etc. with previous parts or are reminded of them.

The drawn map is a dream. You don't have question marks everywhere, but prominent spots on the map where you decide for yourself: something could be there. From the drawing, there could be something there. Most of the time you are simply rewarded for your curiosity and basically get useful things.

Secret doors, at some point there are a lot of them, are simply part of it and I like this uncertainty that you always have at Fromsoft because you don't want to miss anything. You can always find something somewhere, whether it's backtracking or unlocking a shortcut. The top of it is that in the last few hours I've discovered so many more areas and because of that I've been able to kill a lot of bosses. Not only the boss kill but also finding an area gives you so much joy at Fromsoft.

b) bosses

Big or small, optional or story boss, I thought so many were terrific. Radahn, Malenia, just to name two really great fights, show what boss gameplay can do. I especially liked Malenia, who couldn't supplant my favorite boss, Sister Friede. Although it is now the undisputed boss with the most tries for me, that never spoiled the fight for me.

I also liked the multitude of optional bosses. But the recycling bothered me a bit, especially e.g. the black cavalry riders, who were always ABSOLUTELY IDENTICAL, was much too easy for me. The bosses, which then turn into trash mobs, are terrific and typically fromsoft, and they often made me sweat.

The game is also getting more and more difficult, especially the last three areas are really tough. The game also gives you various options to act with different bosses (e.g. Mohg).

Ultimately, the fat bosses also give you armor or weapons, and here too you have to make decisions and choose carefully.

c) fight

Whether magician, two-handed warrior or double katana samurai. There is so much possibility to change your character in Elden Ring, even during the game. I played with katanas for a long time, but also tried different weapons again and again. Later I even trained in faith and prepared myself with invocations before every fight. Halberds, fist weapons, daggers, swords, shields, bows, whips and much more. The Elden Ring arsenal is vast and only a small part of the greater whole. All weapons can be enhanced in various ways. Frost &amp; Bleed? YES. Fire? YES flash? YES. Elden Ring gives you a kit and you can totally lose yourself in it in a positive way.

Talismans replace the rings and only expand the hero's repertoire even more. There are also consumables and a crafting system. Especially the crafting shows Fromsoft's strength: If you read through here, if you look for the books together, then you will be given really important and good opportunities to strengthen your character. Gathering resources was never annoying, just well integrated. Each resource has its own look and at some point you also know what the item is that you collected there. It's not one size fits all, it doesn't all look the same.

In addition to the possibility of PvE co-op NPCs or online partners, you can also summon different spirits. A great feature, but I only used it more often when clearing warehouses. For almost all bosses I personally left them out. Among them there are also really cool items with great figures.

I finally used PvP and co-op a lot. I've helped people with Mohg so much because there were just so many runes for it, which gave me the opportunity to buy a lot of crafting stones to try out more weapons. PvP went much better than in the other parts (fewer lagging opponents) but there are already a lot of brutally strong meta builds here.

I played with bleeding a lot.

Conclusion

10/10 ELDEN LORDS. I love the game and it has climbed the Fromsoft throne for me. My beloved Dark Souls III has been supplanted and in my eyes it deserves Elden Ring. I had 107 hours (+15 with my magician) of constant fun, going through a lot of emotions and just a really good experience.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">
        Read More
      </span> <!----> <!----></button></div> <!----></div></div> <div class="c-siteReview_extra u-grid u-grid-gap-medium g-inner-spacing-medium o-border-thin-top g-border-gray30 c-siteReview_extra-user"><!----> <div class="c-siteReview_externalLink g-color-gray80 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter c-siteReview_flag"><svg class="g-outer-spacing-right-small"><use xlink:href="#flag"></use></svg> <span class="g-text-link u-text-underline-under u-text-uppercase">Report</span></div> <!----> <div class="c-siteReview_platform g-text-bold g-color-gray80 g-text-xsmall u-text-right u-text-uppercase">
      Xbox Series X

      Xbox Series X
    </div></div></div> <!----> <!----></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 10 out of 10" aria-label="User score 10 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_green c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-gray90 c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">10</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/GrayWolf008/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="GrayWolf008">
    GrayWolf008
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Apr 11, 2022
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>This is my first FromSoftware game so take it from someone who's not a FanBoy, I mean I've been wanting to play Dark Souls for the longest time but never got around to actually picking one up.  But after playing Elden Ring for the first time, maybe I'll try FromSoftware other games.
I haven't finished Elden Ring yet but this game is too good, that I have to give it a rating and review.
The exploration is fun and big.
The art work and the graphics are awesome. Especially playing this on an Xbox Series S.
The storyline makes you want to play more.
And the best part, the rewards you get for defeating a boss, after being defeated over 100 times.

Yes there are some little frame drops here and there, to be honest I hardly notice them that much.
And yes the bosses are ridiculously difficult, but that is what to be expected from FromSoftware games. But they give you the option to always run away, level up and fight the bosses again.

This game easily is a 10/10 for me and I have to say it feels like the game of the year.  Without a doubt this game is worth buying.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

    Justreviewin

    Razzmataz
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Apr 8, 2022
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>This is easily one of the best games i have ever played, and believe me when i say I’ve played many.
I joined the feeble cohorts of console gaming when the SEGA Master system was cool. This was the start of a life long infatuation with gaming. Thats where it started. NIntendo,PS, Xbox, indeed even a PC or two have graced this household with its presence. Ive played many, many great games. I’ve rescued the Milky way from fearsome reapers, liberated the nuclear wasteland, stolen thousands of cars, liberated tropical islands, won countless Stanley cups and to boot l, a few world cups. I’ve planned and built cities and I’ve protected man kind in the name if our God emperor! Ive played over 200 hours of Elden ring on my Series X , not nearly as many as I’ve spent on Dark souls one, two or three. But i predict this game will be one of the greats. One of those you keep coming back to. I truly have loved every moment of it. The open world keeps distracting you, leading you astray from your true quest. Visually stunning vistas and alluring lore that keeps you hooked on lorevids on Youtube is accompanied by stellar fighting mechanics and that ever present feeling of joy and fear at the same time. You know the one, where you never know whats next on the epic journey. Bossfights in line with what we’ve come to expect when it comes to FROM, secret and rare items, dragons, fire, magic, stellar soundtrack and of course..Patches!
This game has earned a spot in my all time top ten of games. It is a few patches from top five. (Software updates, that is ;). )
Never wrote a review before.. This seemed like a good time to start!

/Razz</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

    kLRc4GE
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Apr 7, 2022
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>It’s a mixed bag – not very newcomers friendly nor satisfying for veterans.
A lot of n000bs friendly mechanics (summons, bleed, assists, too closely placed “bonfires”) ruined the experience.
No longer I have a sense of archievement.
I was forced to limit myself to play with pure melee build without cheating (enchanting, spells, summons etc.) to get a mildly harder adventure.
Those From Software “lifehacks” gone too far – now You’re not even forced to talk to NPC, to get a map icon info who he is…for example it completely ruined first encounter with Blaidd.
Game is vast and You’re hyped at the beginning – first area (Limgrave) has the best environmental structure (dragon, dungeons, mini-boss, big cart, camp).
Landscape is immersive and for the moment I was feeling epic adventure vibe.
Sadly, this bait for beta access reviewers is going down very fast – too big and empty, stretched without common sense, not rewarding for your time invested…
Dragons are too easy, quests are too complicated for open world, crafting unnecessary (you can’t craft weapons nor armors), legendary weapons are easier to upgrade than normal, dungeons too small, framerate at 35-50 fps, pop-in everywhere, unbalanced weapons (colossal zweihander damage and stagger equal to claymore…), etc…
After 150 hours I’m bored. It’s a promise unfullfiled.
Elden Ring is very overrated and not a masterpiece.
From Software – You can’t put souls series into mainstream.
You sell 12M copies but people are angry and this 7,5 Metacritic rating is VERY accurate.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

    Apr 7, 2022
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>As someone who avoided "souls" games, this one really blew me away! When my last try was "Demon's Souls" on the PS3 and I walked away from it near the beginning, thinking this was just not something I wanted to waste my time on, I never took Elden Ring serious as something I would play. From recommendations and watching some streams, I figured why not give it a shot. And wow, with the HUGE open world you didn't even have to bother about the bosses till you really felt the urge for it.
With this open world concept, the entire "souls" genre changes, leaving the difficulty scaling up to the players. You can try to tackle the bosses head on, doing the old school masochist style marathon to the final boss, or you can run around and explore, expand your arsenal with weapons and spells and even level up as you please, before returning to the "now very easy" headaches known as bosses.

If you are in need of wasting a huge amount of hours, this is the game for you! Because, once you pop....

I have personally played through this game three times by now, it should be considered as addictive as crack!</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>Nicht das beste FromSoft game aber in den Top 3. Es ist wesentlich Einsteigerfreundlicher und wenn man es direkt mit DS1-3, Sekiro, Bloodborne, etc. vergleicht ist es schon ziemlich einfach. Das fällt erst so richtig auf wenn man ins New Game + kommt- was früher das ganze Spiel bei jedem Durchgang noch ein gutes Stück schwerer gemacht hat- Ist bei Elden Ring schlechter ausbalanciert da wenn man alles erkundet und das Spiel im ersten durchlauf abschließt, man extrem überlevelt ist und erst wieder im 4-5 Durchgang ins schwitzen kommt. Abgesehen davon grenzt es an Perfektion:
Die Spielwelt regt zum erkunden an. Jeder point of interest belohnt jeden Besuch. Allg. Das Belohnungssystem ist einfach extrem gut. Die Atmosphäre wird mit FromSoft typischer stimmungsvollen Musik ergänzt. Die Bosskämpfe sind abwechslungsreich (auch wenn hier und dort mal recycelt wurde)und machen extrem Laune auf mehr. NPCs können seit einem jüngsten Update auf der Karte eingesehen werden- was früher extrem kryptisch war- NPCs und ihre quests werden dadurch ein wenig transparenter. Ohne Vorkenntnisse zur Souls Reihe hätte das Game eine glatte 10 bekommen!</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

Todo mundo debería jugar este juego, es una auténtica obra maestra.</span></div> <!----> <!----></div></div> <div class="c-siteReview_extra u-grid u-grid-gap-medium g-inner-spacing-medium o-border-thin-top g-border-gray30 c-siteReview_extra-user"><!----> <div class="c-siteReview_externalLink g-color-gray80 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter c-siteReview_flag"><svg class="g-outer-spacing-right-small"><use xlink:href="#flag"></use></svg> <span class="g-text-link u-text-underline-under u-text-uppercase">Report</span></div> <!----> <div class="c-siteReview_platform g-text-bold g-color-gray80 g-text-xsmall u-text-right u-text-uppercase">
      Xbox Series X
    </div></div></div> <!----> <!----></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 9 out of 10" aria-label="User score 9 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_green c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-gray90 c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">9</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/TnDev/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="TnDev">
    TnDev
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Apr 6, 2022
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>I haven't finished elden ring yet, however, I suspect I'm getting close. This is my first souls type game, and I can say without a doubt this game is very accessible to players new to the painful power struggle that is a fromsoft game. That being said instead of praising the game I will point out my only real problem with the game. Simply put, the game is extremely unintuitive, this can be seen in the way lock-ons work, as well as in navigating the menus. This is nowhere more apparent than in the quest design, and I absolutely adore the open ended quest design, however there are a lot of times when you are given a quest unexpectedly, and then must remember a name or location with no way to repeat dialog. It's frustrating at times but the rest of the game completely sweeps away this frustration. TLDR: The HUD and Menus are bad, and the quest design is annoying</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

    Apr 6, 2022
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>This has been one of the most engrossing and addicting gameplay experiences I have had in years.  This is a difficult and dark experience that is not for everyone, and that's ok.  For me it's been a nonstop thrill ride where death awaits on every corner and new locations come with amazingly detailed environments and new terrible adversaries.  It can feel like a 'Breath of the Wild' fever dream.  I've enjoyed FromSoftware games in the past but never to this level, each hour of play is rewarded with awesome weapons, unlockable items, enemies, and jaw dropping landscapes.  There are bug fixes needed, and it appears that they are being handled in a timely manner, and that is why for me this has been a close to perfect experience.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

Fanboys treating it as best video game of all time? Check!
Should you waste 60 dollars on this "Masterpiece"? Never!</span></div> <!----> <!----></div></div> <div class="c-siteReview_extra u-grid u-grid-gap-medium g-inner-spacing-medium o-border-thin-top g-border-gray30 c-siteReview_extra-user"><!----> <div class="c-siteReview_externalLink g-color-gray80 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter c-siteReview_flag"><svg class="g-outer-spacing-right-small"><use xlink:href="#flag"></use></svg> <span class="g-text-link u-text-underline-under u-text-uppercase">Report</span></div> <!----> <div class="c-siteReview_platform g-text-bold g-color-gray80 g-text-xsmall u-text-right u-text-uppercase">

Haven’t put so many hours in a title in a long time.</span></div> <!----> <!----></div></div> <div class="c-siteReview_extra u-grid u-grid-gap-medium g-inner-spacing-medium o-border-thin-top g-border-gray30 c-siteReview_extra-user"><!----> <div class="c-siteReview_externalLink g-color-gray80 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter c-siteReview_flag"><svg class="g-outer-spacing-right-small"><use xlink:href="#flag"></use></svg> <span class="g-text-link u-text-underline-under u-text-uppercase">Report</span></div> <!----> <div class="c-siteReview_platform g-text-bold g-color-gray80 g-text-xsmall u-text-right u-text-uppercase">
      Xbox Series X
    </div></div></div> <!----> <!----></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 9 out of 10" aria-label="User score 9 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_green c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-gray90 c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">9</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/Alphabrava/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="Alphabrava">
    Alphabrava
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Apr 2, 2022
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>This is a pretty awesome game. Great fight mechanics, deep RPG upgrade system, lots of customisation loot and an immense open world that just keeps coming. The only reason I give it a 9 and birth a 10 is the performance issues; it’s not very well optimised on series x. The ray tracing mode doesn’t look any different to the performance mode… apart from the frame drop, frame rate is a bit jerky and some pop in is seen.

I also think that the dialogue and story elements are too sparse to make a cohesive feeling story. However, it’s a fantastic and well designed open world. The enemies are original and imaginative. I can see why people think they’re cut and paste, but that’s the point of the souls borne games. You learn the patterns and apply your style to each enemy as they present themselves. It has an original feel, although it’s in the dark souls format. No micro transactions or crowbarred in multiplayer. It’s a genuine, honest to god single player experience. It’s got no cynical angles to it. The grind is real but balanced.

Just don’t expect it to hold your hand!</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">
        Read More
      </span> <!----> <!----></button></div> <!----></div></div> <div class="c-siteReview_extra u-grid u-grid-gap-medium g-inner-spacing-medium o-border-thin-top g-border-gray30 c-siteReview_extra-user"><!----> <div class="c-siteReview_externalLink g-color-gray80 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter c-siteReview_flag"><svg class="g-outer-spacing-right-small"><use xlink:href="#flag"></use></svg> <span class="g-text-link u-text-underline-under u-text-uppercase">Report</span></div> <!----> <div class="c-siteReview_platform g-text-bold g-color-gray80 g-text-xsmall u-text-right u-text-uppercase">
      Xbox Series X
    </div></div></div> <!----> <!----></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 10 out of 10" aria-label="User score 10 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_green c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-gray90 c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">10</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/Mornicle/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="Mornicle">
    Mornicle
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Apr 2, 2022
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>I couldn't have asked for more from this release by From Software. The game exceeded my expectations in every regard.</span></div> <!----> <!----></div></div> <div class="c-siteReview_extra u-grid u-grid-gap-medium g-inner-spacing-medium o-border-thin-top g-border-gray30 c-siteReview_extra-user"><!----> <div class="c-siteReview_externalLink g-color-gray80 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter c-siteReview_flag"><svg class="g-outer-spacing-right-small"><use xlink:href="#flag"></use></svg> <span class="g-text-link u-text-underline-under u-text-uppercase">Report</span></div> <!----> <div class="c-siteReview_platform g-text-bold g-color-gray80 g-text-xsmall u-text-right u-text-uppercase">
      Xbox Series X
    </div></div></div> <!----> <!----></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 8 out of 10" aria-label="User score 8 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_green c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-gray90 c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">8</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/BernuGeek/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="BernuGeek">
    BernuGeek
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Apr 2, 2022
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>My final and brief opinion on Elden Ring: They were right on many things, they were wrong on many others as well.  The first experience is incredibly memorable and the main bosses are amazing, the lore is nothing to talk about, although I think it's very similar to Dark Souls and lacks a bit of originality.  The problem is that there comes a point, more precisely in the second half of the game, that it gets very repetitive, the optional bosses are very forgettable, the boss repetition is ridiculously annoying and the game balance is so unstable to the point that you are OP without nor make effort, spoiling the Experience.  The soundtrack is far inferior to past games, especially if we compare it to Dark Souls 3 and Bloodborne, you can count on your fingers which ones are really memorable and incredible.  The exploration of the world itself is phenomenal and intuitive, it's really a revolution of the open world system, but unfortunately that's only true for the first time playing, making the game have very little replay factor, as you've already seen all the new exploration. In short, the game is amazing and extremely fun and addictive, it has a lot of successes but it also has a lot of flaws.  For FromSoftware's first open world game, I'd say they are to be congratulated, they improved a lot from the other games, but honestly it could have been better.  If they had more creativity and time, the game would be immensely more memorable and most of the game's serious flaws would be minimized.  Overall, it's an unforgettable game on your first playthrough and it's really worth it, it's not quite a masterpiece as many have said, for me it's basically an open world Dark Souls 4, but it's worth the investment, especially nowadays where the market of Videogames only cares about money and quantity, while FromSoftware cares more about the artistic factor and quality in their games. Final rating: 8/10</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">
        Read More
      </span> <!----> <!----></button></div> <!----></div></div> <div class="c-siteReview_extra u-grid u-grid-gap-medium g-inner-spacing-medium o-border-thin-top g-border-gray30 c-siteReview_extra-user"><!----> <div class="c-siteReview_externalLink g-color-gray80 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter c-siteReview_flag"><svg class="g-outer-spacing-right-small"><use xlink:href="#flag"></use></svg> <span class="g-text-link u-text-underline-under u-text-uppercase">Report</span></div> <!----> <div class="c-siteReview_platform g-text-bold g-color-gray80 g-text-xsmall u-text-right u-text-uppercase">
      Xbox Series X
    </div></div></div> <!----> <!----></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 5 out of 10" aria-label="User score 5 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_yellow c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-gray90 c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">5</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/Alizaire/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="Alizaire">
    Alizaire
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Apr 1, 2022
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>TLDR recap:
- no local multiplayer (two family members would need two systems and two disks) $$$$ stupid
- the skill level needed, constant dying, almost non-existent margin of error for the average gamer make the game WAYYYYY less fun.  I didn't come here for a part time job. (and this is coming from someone who beat Targit at lvl 23 with an Astrologer)
- forced into pvp just to play with friends.  Stupid, lazy, and bordering on straight up jerkdom

(1) No true local multiplayer.  A family needs TWO xbox units &amp; TWO disks to play what I should be able with one each.  It borders on criminal negligence in today's game market.  Period.
(2)  First From Software game.  To say the survival learning curve is hideous is a laugh.  You die over and over for no reason other than developers thinking it's FUN for professional people with families wanting to relax playing a video game.  There's no such luck with this title.  I understand learning a game and getting better skill, but there is no margin for error for simple mistakes.  This is coming from someone who killed Margit at lvl 23 as an Astrologer...farmed the meteorite staff etc....I researched.  I improved skill.  Still the learning curve is STEEP and unnecessarily harsh.  Think of the average player not the try hards or make tiers like so many other games do to fix it.
(3)  Forcing me to play multiplayer in today's gaming world when I don't want to adds to my frustration.  So I have to have two systems and two disks to play the game with family already and NOW you force us to play pvp vs randoms if we try to play with help.  It doesn't make the game fun for those that don't want pvp.  Just stop it.  It borders on being jerks to your player base.  It's lazy.  Make a separate pvp system without forcing us to comply with it.

Fix these three issues and my rating goes to a 9.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

    Gamer_Daddy
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Apr 1, 2022
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>1st review I write here, 1st souls game. This has to be a 10. Even if its not your style of game one has to admire the sheer scope and game design. Finally a recent game respecting your intelligence and time. No bloat, no railed experiences, 70h in and still hungry! Performance would make it a 9.5 but I’m countering the 0s, PLEASE don’t let those reviews fool you, this game is special</span></div> <!----> <!----></div></div> <div class="c-siteReview_extra u-grid u-grid-gap-medium g-inner-spacing-medium o-border-thin-top g-border-gray30 c-siteReview_extra-user"><!----> <div class="c-siteReview_externalLink g-color-gray80 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter c-siteReview_flag"><svg class="g-outer-spacing-right-small"><use xlink:href="#flag"></use></svg> <span class="g-text-link u-text-underline-under u-text-uppercase">Report</span></div> <!----> <div class="c-siteReview_platform g-text-bold g-color-gray80 g-text-xsmall u-text-right u-text-uppercase">
      Xbox Series X
    </div></div></div> <!----> <div class="c-adMpu g-bg-gray10 u-block c-pageProductReviews_ad-mobile-spacing"><div class="c-adMpu_ad c-adDisplay_container c-adDisplay_container_incontent_boxad spaced blank"><div data-ad="incontent_boxad" data-instance="0" data-disable-initial-load="true" data-constraint="all" class="u-text-center c-adDisplay"></div></div></div></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 9 out of 10" aria-label="User score 9 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_green c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-gray90 c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">9</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/perfect0zer0/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="perfect0zer0">
    perfect0zer0
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Apr 1, 2022
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>Some of the complaints from "Souls veterans" can be easily debunked.
The graphics are maybe a 7/10 at best but the way FromSoft displays their art style that's been developed over the years, in this colossal world, really shines brightly. I found myself stopping at times looking around at the gorgeous view especially on top of large cliffs or mountains. The time of day changes can create different shots as well.
The open world in Elden Ring is done better than most open world games today. That's what's considered "Revolutionary". They kept the souls-like feel despite going open-world which is more than what most game devs are able to do with their games when going in that direction. The way they reuse assets in this game is done properly. The world isn't littered with garbage and utterly useless items making the game feel repetitive (*cough cough Ubisoft games). Some of the bosses you fight early in the game become tough regular enemies later in the game making you as the player feel stronger and accomplished with the knowledge of how to defeat such enemies. The catacombs/dungeons are structured in a way that feel the same but each have their own set of enemies, traps, secrets, rewards and items. There's a reason to go into a specific dungeon because you may want that talisman, weapon, or ash. The recycling of assets in Elden Ring is done in a way that other developers should look at as an example of how to make a game feel fresh for 100 hours. The only other game that has done this well that I've played is Batman Arkham Knight

I wouldn't call the combat boring in any way even if you've been playing Souls games from the beginning. I mean, maybe you're just bored of it? I'm not a souls veteran by any means but I have played Souls 1, Sekiro and now this game. There is a clear difference in scale and choices in Elden Ring. The amount of different builds you can design lets the player choose from literally 50+ options of how to play the game. You can look up builds on youtube as there are many literally just making builds for this game. I think this was FromSoft's way of adding more variety but it may have also added an "easy mode" as there are some builds/weapons that are considered by the community OP and an easy way of running through Elden Ring. (ie. Moonveil, Magic, etc)

Overall, I highly recommend this game to any gamer. It is still difficult compared to your average RPG but will be worth the time and effort if you stick through it.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">
        Read More

    ultraviper
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Mar 31, 2022
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>This was my first FromSoft game and I never expected to finish it because of that. But I just finished with my 3rd playthrough and got 100% of the achievements. The game is that good. It is really fun to just explore around conquering bosses as you come across them. There are hidden secrets everywhere, it doesn't feel like any of the space is wasted like in so many open world games. It does have some problems though. The first problem is that there is no quest interface whatsoever. There are certainly quests, just no way to keep track of them without doing it manually (eg. pen and paper) or the more realistic solution: just google everything. The 2nd big issue is that co-op is just backwards. With most games with jump-in co-op you would ask for help, and people answer. In this game, people have to volunteer to help and then wait around for someone to ask for it. If you want to just co-op the entire game with friends, well you can't, it doesn't work that way. Co-op ends as soon as a player dies or a boss does and you have to set it up all over again. Definitely could have been done better.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

    </div></div></div> <!----> <!----></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 8 out of 10" aria-label="User score 8 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_green c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-gray90 c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">8</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/tomidon/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="tomidon">
    tomidon

  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>Having very little experience completing a souls game. I put myself at the task of finally taking down this game. It took a lot of work multiple restarts of new characters finding different styles and guides to help me out. Yes I did beat it first using the astrologer. It was not easy by no stretch in fact my second time through the game I did the vagabond and used the glorious golden halberd which did make most bosses feel super easy but once I took one the dual wielding great swords did this game feel truly special. All of this to say that the freedom in this game is what truly sets itself apart from former games in the series and the unguided nature of the game sets it apart from other open world games minus a few that did it first. I recommend giving this game a try and once you do finally beat this massive undertaking give new game plus a try as well and don’t be afraid to hit every single spot in the game it makes it that much sweeter.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>This game is very overrated. its not a bad game but its not a great one either. There is no story,  IF you are expecting a Horizon: Zero Dawn story where the characters are engaging then look elsewhere. The combat is bad and most of the enemies are frustrating. I enjoy a challenge but their is a difference between a challenging game and a frustrating one.  The graphics are not that good for a game in 2022. The world is huge but what's the point if most of the world is empty. If you are expecting an rpg with towns like elder scrolls then you will be disappointment.

I dont see how so many critics are giving this game perfect scores. You will spend a lot of hours grinding to level up and your character will still be weak. I don't see the point in leveling up my health by 50 levels and I can still die in 3 hits. This game is a 7 at best. This is my first souls game and i would probably never play another game from this developer. RPGs are some of my favorite games but i never been so frustrated from playing one.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

    </div></div></div> <!----> <!----></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 6 out of 10" aria-label="User score 6 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_yellow c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-gray90 c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">6</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/Lausee-/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="Lausee-">
    Lausee-
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Mar 26, 2022
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>To start, this is my 1st from soft game I have ever played.  Linear games where you die over and over again were never my cup of tea. That being said here is my review of ER after becoming the Elden Lord.

Pros:  The game is absolutely huge. The world Is amazing to explore and  almost every nook and crannie holds something to find or discover. Boss fights are epic but can't get a little frustrating if you play certain classes.  The character building /level up system is pretty good as well.

Cons: The story is very hard to follow as you are told something once and you have no record of anything you were told so if you forgot something you're pretty much clueless unless you look it up online. Same goes for the hidden sidequest throughout the game. It's one of the most poorly constructed quest /side mission implementation I've ever seen in any game.  The enemies that are supposed to be trash mobs running around the open world are sometimes harder than the main bosses which is ridiculous on its own.

Recap.  All in all it is a good game If you want to randomly run around the amazing open world and kill stuff with no rhyme or reason or any way to look back to see what npc's have told you along the way. If you are into story or dialog this is definitely not a game for you.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

      Xbox Series X
    </div></div></div> <!----> <!----></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 10 out of 10" aria-label="User score 10 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_green c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-gray90 c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">10</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/longridr/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="longridr">

  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Mar 26, 2022
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>The only time I've ever even considered giving a game a perfect 10/10. The perfect mix of exploration, challenge, Boss Fights, Lore, amazing sound and music and Out-right fun.

This game is not for people who want their hands held, or are hell bent on a linear game play style. Don't go into this if you're expecting another Skyrim, it will teach you a brutal lesson, that only gets more and more brutal, as seen by many reviews. Just scroll through and most scores under 9 will be complaining about a lack of direction, or too much difficulty in a game that's about discovery and choreography, more than it is grinding to be over-leveled, which seems to be something people can't understand, very curious.

The game that breaks the mold and managed to create what i believe is the greatest souls game, and perhaps one of the greatest games of all time! In this case, most bad reviews can be seen as a good way to feel better about your own gameplay experience!</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>I wanted to give this a 9.5 but felt it was worth the round up.

Is the game perfect? no. It has minor technical issues. However, the Gameplay is absolutely fantastic. The world is massive, rich and detailed in ways that will have you constantly surprised. I am currently on my second play through and still finding new things constantly.

It is a tough game, but don't be afraid to explore and level up when you hit a wall, and remember to summon other players, we are all here to help. Have fun in the lands between!

    Mar 24, 2022
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>Elden Ring has some great attributes... It looks nice, there is a lot to explore and discover, etc... But the reason I can't give it more than 6/10 is because... Well... It isnt fun. To get anywhere you have to grind and repeat over and over and over and over. I don't think I've ever put the game down whilst feeling satisfied. I usually quit feeling irritated or bored to death. There is a fine line between difficult and dumb/irritating. I'm a big Metroid fan, so hard games arent usually an issue. But this game just makes itself hard for the sake of it. It's not fun, it's just boring. The controls arent responsive enough imo to warrant the difficulty. I'm level 155 and the game goes from killing soliders with one hit to getting my ass handed to me in two hits by the same soldiers 2 minutes later. In summary, the game isnt fun. It's tedious</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">
