      Xbox Series X
    </div></div></div> <!----> <!----></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 5 out of 10" aria-label="User score 5 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_yellow c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-gray90 c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">5</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/ganisberke/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="ganisberke">
    ganisberke
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Mar 23, 2022
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>Elden Ring is a totally average game. Don't believe the trolls and the toxic community talk. Many people consider From Software to be the originator of the Souls genre. It actually has its origins in Nihon Falcom. Therefore, according to them, Miyazaki is a messiah. However, Miyazaki and the Souls team is still making the same mistakes.

Objective problems:

-Hitboxes are not good. There are times when it reminds me of the DS2.
-Boss designs are very unbalanced. They didn't really work well with many bosses.
-The game gets too repetitive. Open world exploration is nice, but it gets boring quickly.
-There seems to be a lot of items, but in the end, a few items are the most useful. The game forces you for make to broken builds. Because some boss designs require it. All builds look alike. For example, more than half of even PvP uses blood builds.
-Optimization is still not fixed and every update is getting worse.
-Spells are powerful. Playing spell builds are more advantageous in many ways.
-Camera angles are not good. It really causes trouble. When the number of enemies is high, you cannot control field of view.
-Lore quality is definitely a controversial topic. However, it has the same lore in other Souls games. Only their names have changed. George R. R. Martin is just PR work.
-Enemies are just based on nonstop spawn attacks with endless stamina as like most of bosses.
-Many of the bosses repeat themselves. Most bosses are either the same or reskin version.
-The hit feeling is not good. Especially the bosses don't even react properly to your attacks.
-It has a toxic and cancerous player base.
-Artificial intelligence problems. A real disaster.
-It is a headache for some attacks in the game to pass through objects.

Conclusion:

This game is not a masterpiece. Not on a new ip. It's just Dark Souls 4 with open world.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">
        Read More
      </span> <!----> <!----></button></div> <!----></div></div> <div class="c-siteReview_extra u-grid u-grid-gap-medium g-inner-spacing-medium o-border-thin-top g-border-gray30 c-siteReview_extra-user"><!----> <div class="c-siteReview_externalLink g-color-gray80 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter c-siteReview_flag"><svg class="g-outer-spacing-right-small"><use xlink:href="#flag"></use></svg> <span class="g-text-link u-text-underline-under u-text-uppercase">Report</span></div> <!----> <div class="c-siteReview_platform g-text-bold g-color-gray80 g-text-xsmall u-text-right u-text-uppercase">
      Xbox Series X
    </div></div></div> <!----> <div class="c-adMpu g-bg-gray10 u-block c-pageProductReviews_ad-mobile-spacing"><div class="c-adMpu_ad c-adDisplay_container c-adDisplay_container_incontent_boxad spaced blank"><div data-ad="incontent_boxad" data-instance="0" data-disable-initial-load="true" data-constraint="all" class="u-text-center c-adDisplay"></div></div></div></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 10 out of 10" aria-label="User score 10 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_green c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-gray90 c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">10</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/BeardedYoda/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="BeardedYoda">
    BeardedYoda
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Mar 23, 2022
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>Full disclosure, I am a fairly big fan of the Dark Souls series of games and have been playing Souls games for nearly a decade now; so take that into consideration. With that out of the way, I would like to say that Elden Ring is simply incredible. I have not experienced a newly released RPG that has enthralled me this much with its world and gameplay since Fallout 4 - back in 2015. The diversity in builds and play styles, the humongous amount of interesting dungeons and environments, the plentiful and awesome loot, and of course the difficult but very fun to fight enemies and bosses - all of these elements are done very, very well in Elden Ring. There are some technical problems here and there, mainly with the frame rate and some controller delay - but this will not destroy the awesome experience. As a send off I want to say this, Elden Ring is not short and it does not hold your hand, this could seem overwhelming to some gamers, but I want to say that Elden Ring hardly ever felt like a chore. While Elden Ring is a long game, it's so open and has so much in it that I hardly felt like I was spending too much time playing it. Even if you are crunched for time from work or school, I still would highly recommend trying out this awesome game.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

Combat feels amazing, one of the most full and interesting open worlds I've played, and an insanely captivating world and story.</span></div> <!----> <!----></div></div> <div class="c-siteReview_extra u-grid u-grid-gap-medium g-inner-spacing-medium o-border-thin-top g-border-gray30 c-siteReview_extra-user"><!----> <div class="c-siteReview_externalLink g-color-gray80 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter c-siteReview_flag"><svg class="g-outer-spacing-right-small"><use xlink:href="#flag"></use></svg> <span class="g-text-link u-text-underline-under u-text-uppercase">Report</span></div> <!----> <div class="c-siteReview_platform g-text-bold g-color-gray80 g-text-xsmall u-text-right u-text-uppercase">

    Ozzyboy1010
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Mar 22, 2022
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>This has to be my absolute favorite Souls-like and From Software game. The game delivers on its promises of retaining that soul's formula. This game had me dying in my first 5 minutes of playtime. This will come across as frustrating for some, but that's what it's intended to be. The open-world nature of the Lands Bettwen is majestic in even the most colorless regions. One of the main reasons I found Sekiro to be boring is that all locations had the same feel. Most of the enemies were natural and earthly, looking to be rememberable. Elden RIng is everything I was hoping for in a From game. And if I could give a more accurate rating, I would give this a 9.9 because Elden RIng, in my eye, is flawless in world-building and charter design. I have one major criticism of the game, and I admit it is quite a funny criticism. In my eye, it has one of the worst opening theme songs in any of the From games. But besides that main criticism, this game is flawless and my pick for a possible match of the year.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>After a rough start on xbox side of things, this game is now a true masterpiece. Definitely as of writing this in March is the GOTY and probably will be top contender come the end of the year still. Though the game doesnt hold your hand throughout like most open world MMO games it is balanced enough so that you can go out explore as much as you want and still have a sense of direction on the path to complete game via sites of grace placed throughout the massive world. With dangers around every corner and bosses ranging from small to towering giants this game has it all, the added ability to play with your friends and explore together is a much loved bonus. Because sometimes (most times) you'll find yourself needing that extra hand to help defeat a boss or dungeon. No friends to play eith? No worries elden rings also gives you thr ability early on to summon spirits to your side to help you fight and defeat enemies as well as summon random players from other worlds into yours to help, along with you being summoned to theirs if wanted. In all this game really dies have it all. And will leave you wondering what's next throughout as you rise your steed around slashing or using magical abilities to decimate hordes of enemies.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Mar 19, 2022
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>This game is NOT accessible to everyone despite what the paid reviewers have said. I should have known as most content creators are just looking to get paid, not actually be helpful in any way.

I had some experience with From games going in. I did almost beat the base game Dark Souls 3. I did play a bit of Bloodborne. So it’s not like I came in blind or unsuspecting. But watching footage and listening to “reviewers” say this game is accessible gave me hope that maybe this would be a more fun version of the previous titles I played through. Nope. This is just as painful as any other souls game. And what’s worse is I convinced a friend to pick it up thinking that and he had zero experience with these kind of games and basically ally wasted $60.

I’ve put around 30 hours into the game. I’ve over-leveled myself because I just wanted to experience the game and the world in a more casual fashion. I don’t care to be a pro at this game. The open world is fantastic. It’s one of the best open world maps I’ve ever seen. Extremely dense. No place is the same. Packed with stuff to actually find and see. It’s filled with caves and dungeons and open world bosses everywhere. I can’t even count the amount of enemy types. So the world, the combat, the exploration, are all top notch as usual.

But it’s brutal out there. I often find myself dying still in a few shoots to almost anything. Arrows and rocks are buried from across the map from enemies that will destroy you. Trying to get out of combat just to use your map again is tedious. I guess I expected the open world part to be more casual and to have a decent way for leveling but this is not the case. Glitch farming methods are the only real way you can even level in this game and it’s no wonder everyone cheeses them.

Questing is absurd. I understand and accept that this is how From does it. I’m not here to try and change it. But doing quests is insanely confusing, and I just end up watching guides because I don’t want to spend hundreds of hours and multiple play throughs to do them. Many quests can be missed.

Bosses themselves haven’t been too bad depending on play style. But again, I over-leveled with a broken farming method and play a Mage so I’ve got range and a general OPness to me. But even at that you still die in a couple shots if not careful. So anyone who thinks they can over-level to the point of 1 shoting bosses or tanking all their attacks will be let down. I hate when gaming companies do this — lure you into a false sense of being powerful. I think that happens here. Even though you can get more powerful in ER than any other game they’ve made, you won’t really feel it and still die a ton.

I think a 7 is very appropriate for this title. There’s still plenty more to say, both good and bad, but I digress. It’s a good game. It’s not game if the year. It’s not game if the decade. It’s just a really solid game from a really solid developer. It’s just a game that’s not meant for everyone, despite how much I hate that statement and think it’s a terrible one. If your not a Souls player and lover, this game is not a entry to it.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">
        Read More
      </span> <!----> <!----></button></div> <!----></div></div> <div class="c-siteReview_extra u-grid u-grid-gap-medium g-inner-spacing-medium o-border-thin-top g-border-gray30 c-siteReview_extra-user"><!----> <div class="c-siteReview_externalLink g-color-gray80 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter c-siteReview_flag"><svg class="g-outer-spacing-right-small"><use xlink:href="#flag"></use></svg> <span class="g-text-link u-text-underline-under u-text-uppercase">Report</span></div> <!----> <div class="c-siteReview_platform g-text-bold g-color-gray80 g-text-xsmall u-text-right u-text-uppercase">
      Xbox Series X

    Mar 18, 2022
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>Lets start by saying i will not be referring to this game as a masterpiece as that horse has been beaten to death? Elden Ring is a good game, but that's it. Its dated as F! In fact it brought back memories of Dragons Lair for me. Move left - swing sword - move right - back step - swing sword what year is it? The exploration in the game is by far the only reason it gets as high a score from me personally. Its super fun to explore and find new places and enemies to kill but this game is so repetitive, repetitive, repetitive, repetitive. Boss battles are the same, enemies everywhere are the same. It's a great step in a the right direction but if you're going to open your world map then you got to have a reason to live in it, it has to be an interesting place for me to ROLE PLAY. Not overly difficult if you level up and explore the world for better gear and weapons, but why else would you be playing an RPG. Combat is simple and fair most of the time and by fair i mean if you get hit you get punished, that's what these games are about. Sadly because that mechanic is so old and stale once you master moving and taking small bites you can really own this game. Its good but not as good as some other RPG'S over the years. Like Dragons Lair in the arcades as a kid a lot of people got pissed off the game was so hard and wanted their Quarters back. But if you just learned the patterns to the dungeons the Quarters started to go really far. If people were still buying physical copies of games Elden Ring would have its own pre-owned bin at every location. Solid 7/10</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

    Mar 16, 2022
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>I got Elden Ring on launch day and was blown away with it. The scenery is great, music is nice, plays like Dark Souls, I was in heaven.

But the the major bosses are just very, very unfair. I'm a FromSoft veteran who's completed the King's Field and Dark Souls series, Bloodborne and Sekiro multiple times. This game isn't difficult like Sekiro or Bloodborne difficult. Those bosses were challenging, but very do-able. The problem I have, is that the majority of bosses in Elden Ring just spam attacks absolutely non-stop with infinite FP and stamina, leaving an absolute minuscule window to get hits in. Soloing this game is nigh-on impossible, especially late game when the difficulty is rammed even higher and suddenly.

These games, which heavily punish the player for mindless aggression, Miyazaki is quite happy to not apply that rule to his AI. And it proves how BS a boss is when noone even drops down co-op summon signs, because they don't want to go through that certain boss again.

I'm not saying it needs to be made easier, just a little evenly balanced. But then maybe try and embrace a wider audience by adding a slightly easier mode? All you need to do really is keep runes on death, that's it. But that's just me.

Rated it a 7 out of 10, because outside of the major bosses, this is a fun game, which I enjoyed with great exploration and design.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">
        Read More
      </span> <!----> <!----></button></div> <!----></div></div> <div class="c-siteReview_extra u-grid u-grid-gap-medium g-inner-spacing-medium o-border-thin-top g-border-gray30 c-siteReview_extra-user"><!----> <div class="c-siteReview_externalLink g-color-gray80 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter c-siteReview_flag"><svg class="g-outer-spacing-right-small"><use xlink:href="#flag"></use></svg> <span class="g-text-link u-text-underline-under u-text-uppercase">Report</span></div> <!----> <div class="c-siteReview_platform g-text-bold g-color-gray80 g-text-xsmall u-text-right u-text-uppercase">

  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>What you should really take note of here is these “0” out of 10 reviews,    Note how much they read more like petulant hyperbole than anything close to a critique.     Well that’s because to expect this game to be different than the other Fromsoft games is ignorant at best,    It takes what works from the rest of their work and finally starts to trim away from the fat that made prior games more like exclusionary niche titles and opened the genre to be much more accessible.      The game never seems to stop opening up into new areas to explore and when played alongside friends has created a gaming experience I’ve found lacking in the industry for a longerg time.    The open world allows for moving around and away from moments that served as roadblocks in prior titles.    Can’t beat that boss?    No problem, just go level up or try out a new weapon set up and come back.    No  more banging your head against the wall as you do the same fight for the 50th time.     You can go at your own place and there is more variety to the game than just big sword smash and roll.        And while the graphics are far from cutting edge, the game reminded me how little that matters in a game.        Thanks for the stories Fromsoft, can’t wait to see what’s next.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

I'm  someone who's liked the previous darksouls and in love with Sekiro but this is just a bland wastelands game stuck on hard mode.     ThaddeusMagee
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Mar 13, 2022
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>I’m astonished at the reviews for Dark Souls 4. This is the dark souls you already know and love (or hate). To put it simply: if you don’t like dark souls or fromsoftware’s previous titles, stay away from this. It’s more of the same. There is nothing new here, other than an expanded map you can move through freely.

Because dozens of games do horseback riding better. Do exploration better. Do map design better (there are no cities, towns, or anything other than ruins here), do leveling better. This is the exact same dark souls formula that fromsoft has always pumped out.

Don’t be fooled by the hype. It’s dark souls.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

    dan-man
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Mar 13, 2022
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>7.5 stars. A beautiful but frustrating and flawed fantasy adventure. I didn't finish the game. The endless bosses and recycled areas towards the end were too much for me. I am looking forward to playing a real game with a real story now. But this game was pleasant enough and fascinating to play for the first 30-40 hours, then its flaws begin to become apparent.

The lack of armour, meaningful RPG elements, weapons, direction, story, and lack of polish in combat and boss battles. Not to mention getting killed through walls, glitches, poorly implemented multiplayer, and zero character development or journal to aid in your adventures. However, these flaws are greatly overlooked in favour of the beautiful world, and I suppose that is the case with most reviewers.

But, make no mistake, this is a VERY frustrating game! Which is a shame. Because it is needlessly so. As of writing, almost two weeks after its release, judging from achievements, only 15% of players have finished it yet. I won't be one of those people, I have better things to do than waste hours on boss after boss after boss. But it was a lovely world for the first 30 hours and might be worth buying just to experience it for that alone, but afterwards, prepare for an unpleasant time, quite often, interlaced with fascination at the world design.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Mar 13, 2022
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>This is possibly the best game I have ever played. The open world feels so exciting all the time. Compared to the standard Ubisoft game, which boasts a huge map, despite the fact that travelling is tedious and time consuming, elden ring’s world properly encourages exploration by rewarding the player no matter what direction they explore. In my opinion, the best thing about the game is the fact that it truly lets you do whatever the hell you want to. In previous fromsoft titles, new areas were completely locked behind a major boss fight, whereas in elden ring, you can find your way around just about everything if you look hard enough. Fromsoftware uses this feature in a super creative way by adding teleporting devices and even trap chests, which teleport the player to a high level area which the player can either choose to warp back home or explore this dangerous area for very valuable loot.
It’s a shame people are trying to tarnish (get it) it’s reputation simply because they think they deserve for the game to be made exactly their way</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>Wow. Just wow. This is my second FromSoft souls type game and it’s amazing. I’m still half way through it but I had to leave a rating. I’ve put 50hrs into this game and I still have so much more to find and do. The graphics are amazing. There isn’t 50 map markers telling me to do some lame side quest. Every other open world game has repetitive side quests. I don’t have to spend half my time playing the game picking up materials (Horizon forbidden west). I find a map and I look at it. I see something on the map that looks interesting and I go there. I get a boss fight and badass loot. This is what a Medieval style game should be like. It’s challenging. It’s a long game if you play it that way. It’s not filled with BS to have bragging rights that it takes X time to complete it. It’s An amazing experience. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND this game to anyone who isn’t easily frustrated. Lol.   </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>e is trash - it plays like a janky game with old gen graphics and interface that belongs in the late 90s.. not 2022

Zero storyline.. apparently it’s a uNiQue MeTHoD of Storytelling.. but seems to me just a way to 1) not have to pay for voice actors because almost every NPC apart from a choice few are complete mutes even human characters 2) hiding the lack of programming ability to maintain loops or behaviors for the NPCs - so a) everytime you touch a grace or fast travel anywhere - every NPC / flower / bird goes back to the same exact spot and starts their day like some weird Truman show - Groundhog Day **** b) no immersion and no permanence in the game - might as well just run past every bad guy until you get the main boss because as soon as you go somewhere to level up every single bad guy will be reincarnated in the exact same spots, walk the exact same paths and do the exact same thing
c) the can’t program interactions with the bosses with the environment well and limited environmental destruction so they have to lock you in the room with every boss so you ‘can’t escape’ but realistically it’s because they can’t program these creatures to interact with the world C) Making the game a complete grind to level up “to make the game difficult and rewarding” - nah bollocks - it’s just because the game is much more shallow than it advertised and so it makes pointless grinding and one hit kill bosses you have to flawlessly fight again and again just to pad out this lifeless game.     Mar 11, 2022
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>Let me start off by saying that I've loved From games for a long time, but Elden Ring jumped the shark for me. The first 60-70% or so of the game is a ton of fun, and I thoroughly enjoyed it. But the boss design, especially in late game is just... mindbogglingly bad. I won't put specifics in here so as to avoid spoilers, but I was feeling so bummed about the state of this game that I created an account here to write this review.

I looked forward to this game for years, but the late game bosses just make it completely unenjoyable. It feels like beating them has nothing to do with skill or learning, but just dumb luck. It feels like From needs to recalibrate their expectations for boss design. I'll probably just play the first 70% of the game or so going forward, but I'm not even sure if I'll stick around for that.

I feel so bummed out about this game. I stayed up late to play it when it released, and felt like a little kid again with how hyped I was. Such a genuine let down to not be able to play through the whole game and enjoy it.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>El juego es excelente y para ver lo bueno hay miles de review el tema es lo malo y que no lo hace un 10/10 y a mi criterio es, en la exploración muchas veces el objeto a descubrir es un pedazo de planta que no sirve para nada, o un hongo, debieran de haber incluido en estas zonas más materiales de mejora de armas, ya que  es un problema la escasez de los mismos, debido a que por lo general uno va a empezar a mejorar un arma de arranque de la partida y la verdad q no hay forma de saber si el arma encontrada a las 60hs de estar jugando va a escalar mejor o peor que la que tenemos equipada, por lo tanto van quedando relegadas al inventario de a decenas y solo usaremos 4 o 5 en toda la partida, quizás hubiera sido mejor resumir el juego a 12 armas como lo hizo bloodborne. Otro punto negativo son las quest secundarias, en estas si hubiera hecho falta algún tipo de indicador o un guiño del personaje de donde encontrarlo la próxima vez o de que hacer, por que literal es imposible completarlas sin mirar una guía, lo cual le quita al juego ese extra de andar a ciegas y lo convierte en algo monótono el tener q ver una guía, volver al juego ir a ese punto x tener un dialogo, volver a la guía, ver el siguiente paso, volver al juego, hacerlo..... arruina la experiencia. Fuera de eso es un excelente juego y la realidad por ahora es que la dificultad está presente al inicio, una vez alcanzado el nivel 60  con tu arma favorita en +17 algún stat de fuerza o destreza en 40  y unas cenizas de invocación  en +6 la dificultad baja al 50%. Por ejemplo arranque el juego como  es esperado y en lugar de ir a la segunda y tercera zona, me fui para la cuarta el desafío era alto pero la fue peleando y lo completo hasta donde se podía, y luego al ir a las zonas que en realidad eran la 2 y 3, me la estoy pasando matando a enemigos poderosos de 4 golpes   .para resumir tiene una duración monstruosa ya que explorando al 100% y jugando sin guías a la primera recurrendo luego a ellas para sacar el 100 de lo que ofrece cada una de las zonas, con quest incluidas, llevo unas 60 hs y calculo que recién un 50% del juego, y aun sigo enganchado cosa que no me paso con otro mundo abierto</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

    </div></div></div> <!----> <!----></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 9 out of 10" aria-label="User score 9 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_green c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-gray90 c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">9</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/Neb76/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="Neb76">
    Neb76
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Mar 10, 2022
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>Having played Demon Souls, Bloodborne, and Sekiro, this isn't my first rodeo with FromSoftware and I'm really digging the NOT HOLDING YOUR HAND APPROACH open world aspect to a souls like game. The UI takes some getting used to but is NOT the garbage that has spewed out of the mouths of prominent developers of other game franchises. (Ubisoft and Guerilla could definitely learn something from this) Story wise it's minimalistic but well done and unique. My medieval fantasy cup of tea. Control wise it's really a matter of understanding the mechanics. If you're not used to souls like mechanics the controls are going to seem poor to you. The graphics are top notch particularly on quality mode. Performance wise...I'm really dissatisfied with it on my Series X. My hope is that FromSoftware steps up to the plate to remedy this. Otherwise this game would be a 10 for me.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">
        Read More

    Biggun
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Mar 10, 2022
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>C'est un action donjon RPG assez inspiré de Zelda mais hélas dans la ligne éditoriale détestable de From Software. On y retrouve les mécaniques RPG ringardes pour hardcore gamers comme pas de sauvegarde manuelle ennemis qui se repeuplent dans une zone à chaque utilisation du point de grâce des ennemis à affronter obligatoirement avant le boss.
Toutes ces mécaniques cassent l'immersion dans un jeu en monde ouvert le réalisme y étant aux abonnés absents.
Le jeu traine les défauts obsolètes des Dark Souls qu'il aurait été bien inspiré de laisser de côté. La narration et la direction artistique maîtrisées ne **** pas les défauts primaires du jeu.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

      Xbox Series X
    </div></div></div> <!----> <!----></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 8 out of 10" aria-label="User score 8 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_green c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-gray90 c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">8</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/SownHornet100/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="SownHornet100">
    SownHornet100
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Mar 10, 2022
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>Elden Ring has quickly become one of my favorite games of all time. The world and aesthetic is beautiful and I find myself frequently getting sidetracked by some new dungeon or a unique town or area that just makes me want to explore it all. The combat is as fluent as ever, FromSoft has perfected their style and it's as fun as it has ever been. I've seen people talk about how bad the graphics are or how many issues they've discovered. The graphics may be somewhat dated, but it doesn't take away from how much I enjoyed the game. The only issue I've come across was when I was trying to load into a friend's world to help them with a boss, but when I loaded I received the "enemy felled" message and was sent back to my world. The issue was quickly resolved though, but was still annoying at the time. The story is vague, like many other FromSoft games, but there is just so much more in just item descriptions alone that interested me. I haven't beaten every boss yet, but I have dumped 60 hours into the game and overcome some of the more challenging enemies in the game. The fights are tough, but always fair. I haven't encountered a boss that was that I genuinely didn't enjoy fighting. My only issue are the sidequests. Sometimes they're hard to keep track of and some of the npcs would move to a location that just seemed random until the added context later in the quest, . Eventually it made sense, but it didn't make it any less tedious trying to find where they were in the massive world. I know FromSoft likes to be minimalistic with stuff like that, but some kind of log to just keep track of what quest I had started would have been appreciated. Overall, the game isn't the most graphically advanced and definitely has some issues, but I've been enjoying the game so much despite the few issues I did run into. The world is aesthetically beautiful and there are endless possibilities with exploration still left. I can't wait to fill out the rest of my map and maybe find some secret areas and fell more enemies.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

The World is dark, dangerous and devious and I want to explore every nook and cranny of it.
Storytelling in this game isn't in my taste but I can appreciate its formulae and combat I admit I have to get used to but I'm getting there.

  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>Pros:

Very big and full open world with the game rewarding the player for exploration, boss fights feel engaging and difficult but not impossible.

Cons:

Drops frames constantly on Xbox SX 60fps mode, feels as if the game would be so much more satisfying given a smooth frame rate.

Certain weapons in the game are overpowered and can take the fun out of killing bosses with exploitations leading to over levelled characters (of course you don’t necessarily have to do these however progress does slow down at higher levels).</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

Open world significantly exceeded my expectations with visually stunning and varied regions, fighting mechanics aren’t quite as sharp and unforgiving as Sekiro but incorporate some new elements, dying is less inconvenient than in previous souls games, and storytelling has been stepped up while staying true to From’s signature style of starting vague with a big picture and unraveling the details as you go.  Huge replay value. With lots of areas to explore you can level up at your own rate without the game feeling too “grindy” or overbearing. This is a huge improvement over their past releases. Also, I love that you now have a save point right before the boss! This makes it better for learning boss moves and over coming the challenge.     Mar 9, 2022
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>It is with zero hyperbole that I say that Elden Ring is the most ambitious game I have ever played. The sheer amount of hours it must have taken to make this game is honestly baffling and I never thought games could reach this level of craftsmanship. I dont know if video games as a whole have just gotten more soulless but Elden ring literally took my back to the sense of wonder and adventure I started playing games in the first place for. You'll be playing and you'll finish a huge challenge and then you're rewarded with this insane view that just takes your breath away. . This game is incredible and I had to review this simply for the fact that I saw other people giving it zeroes.  If you're a gamer  you will be missing out if you do not play this.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>This game is addictive!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!&amp;&amp;&amp;&amp;</span></div> <!----> <!----></div></div> <div class="c-siteReview_extra u-grid u-grid-gap-medium g-inner-spacing-medium o-border-thin-top g-border-gray30 c-siteReview_extra-user"><!----> <div class="c-siteReview_externalLink g-color-gray80 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter c-siteReview_flag"><svg class="g-outer-spacing-right-small"><use xlink:href="#flag"></use></svg> <span class="g-text-link u-text-underline-under u-text-uppercase">Report</span></div> <!----> <div class="c-siteReview_platform g-text-bold g-color-gray80 g-text-xsmall u-text-right u-text-uppercase">
      Xbox Series X
    </div></div></div> <!----> <div class="c-adMpu g-bg-gray10 u-block c-pageProductReviews_ad-mobile-spacing"><div class="c-adMpu_ad c-adDisplay_container c-adDisplay_container_incontent_boxad spaced blank"><div data-ad="incontent_boxad" data-instance="0" data-disable-initial-load="true" data-constraint="all" class="u-text-center c-adDisplay"></div></div></div></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 8 out of 10" aria-label="User score 8 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_green c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-gray90 c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">8</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/Ayvaza/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="Ayvaza">
    Ayvaza
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Mar 9, 2022
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>does a good job as a exploration game, but:
- savegame bugs took like 10h of effort, boss killing and farming and weapon and material grinding from me. how does a souls game fail at saving, the previous parts were saving at every opportunity. thats the biggest minus from me
- the game has no clear red line, hugeass open world and no clear directions, cryptic introductions ruins the fun and drag the story longer the wrong way
- progression is superslow, if you struggle with your current stats against enemies, you will struggle more in the upcoming regions. monsters get superhard, runes (exp) and smithing materials are very scarce, i wasnt able to get my weapons past +4 after 50h of gameplay. so i used the rapier +8 which you get as a gift after beating some mainstory boss.
-great runes are a great idea but a greater dissapointment. why do we have to use rune arcs to buff them up? i found in all myhours so far 4-5 rune arcs (similar to humanity and embers) in the open world and those expire once you die and you will probably die every 5 mins once.
- effing dragons at some endgame location give 3,5k runes... and you need at lvl60 or so around 25k exp for a level up. and dragons would at that point one shot you with basic attacks. the game is super tough, i dont know why they went with that kind of progression design. this game is supposed to be a challenge, not a parkour and avoid monster simulation
- the trap chests are a nice idea, but can lead anyone who plays without guides into desperation. i for my part hated that idea

+ great enemy variaty
+ great combat gameplay
+ great mounted combat
+ ashes of war and summon noble spirits are a awesome addition to the game
+ awesome looking bosses (which drop almost no usefull weapons or souls which can be turned into weapons)
+ fast travel is also an awesome addition to the game, from any point (except inside traps)
+ the exploration is also awesome, you can explore so many regions thanks to the jump button
+ some regions seriously looked dreamlike, which almost never was the case in any souls game . which mostly has gory stuff and locations</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>This game is a masterpiece and deservers the score. It's probably the best game I've ever played and I have already over 100 hours.
The gameflow, gameplay, combat is perfection. They took the best from all souls games and created a magnum opus in terms of combat.
The enemys/bosses and areas are so amazing and detailed that I am still stunned when I look at it.
Cinematics are awesome and it has so much good content, that it blew my mind.
The quests and story is also wonderful and I was never more into a game as Elden Ring overall. Definetely a 10/10.

Now lets talk about the current "controvery":
Some Game devs (Especially the sore loosers at ubisoft) badmouthed this game with various untrue reasons like: missing UI, bad graphics, overhyped by game critics and so on (,while being unable to make good games theirself).
Saddest part is, that some ubi-fanboys are reviewbombing this game and giving their favourite "open world game" perfect score. They usually copy ubisofts and over devs words and just add the "bad performance" part for PC, which mostly has been fixed for people above min. reqiurements.

If you don't like it or even hate the game, I guess it's okay if you give like a 5. But it shouldn't be objectively possible to give below 5 because it's in every aspect amazing. Now to all the Fanboys/Clowns: If you really hate it, it's okay. Taste is objective.
If you think the game is bad because of gameplay or graphics then you didn't know what game you bought in the first place and you are a fool.
If the game doesn't run smoothly, next time read the System requirements, which they posted like 1 week even before release.

If you cry about UI, lore or just copy the stupid/false words from the "devs", just go to your corner and play your easy/boring/bad microtransaction games with 800 questmarker/waypoints on the map where you just follow a path like a bot without thinking/playing yourself. If that's the case, you are the reason why gaming gets bad and gives money to those big "triple A" companys, who exploit clowns like you.

If you want to fight me in an argument about this, just add me on steam or write me a comment there. Can't wait how many clowns are going to write "interesting stuff" and white knight their favourite game in comparison to elden ring.

Its as if castlevania symphony of the night had a baby with Ultima online in a 3D world.  I’ve never seen an an open world so detailed and vast - there are 2 levels… and theres no minimap like in the old days so you are forced to actually explore.  Combat fees like its a constant learning experience- death is there to teach you what not to do on your next attempt.

The gane is easy once you learn how to beat the mental puzzles (combat techniques, weaknesses, area tips using lore, terrain, etc) and by the time you realize it you’ll wish you could experience this masterpiece  again as if it was your first time.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

    Mar 8, 2022
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>Honestly such an amazing game. I love the fact that you rarely see markers on the map and you can adventure the land to discover stuff on your own. It doesn't have any handholding, nothing that tells you where to go typically. The thing that differentiates this from most other open world games is that the devs of other games want to show you their work, but from wants you to discover it. Its got a huge open world to discover and tons of challenges to face, I feel like the issue most people may have is the fact that its fighting takes time to learn, which makes some encounters really difficult, but other that I love this game.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

      Xbox Series X
    </div></div></div> <!----> <!----></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 10 out of 10" aria-label="User score 10 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_green c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-gray90 c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">10</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/wipsywaps/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="wipsywaps">
    wipsywaps
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Mar 8, 2022
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>As a long time fan of Fromsoft's Dark Souls trilogy, Elden Ring takes the cake as the best of them all. I'm naturally a skeptical person and don't go throwing around the phrase "the best" too often. They plucked and dropped some of the best features from all of their past games and beautifully orchestrated them together with an interesting original story and produced a masterpiece. The music in ER is amazing as well and deserves recognition. There are a lot of reviews on here, and all over the internet, that make ER sound like the worst game ever made. A minute sum of these reviews and comments are valid and bring up reasonable points. However, a majority of them are emotionally motivated and charged by the overwhelming popularity this game has imbued. In the end, Elden Ring will go down as one of the greatest ever in-spite of the negative "reviews" a few "gamers" made because they couldn't git gud.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">
        Read More
      </span> <!----> <!----></button></div> <!----></div></div> <div class="c-siteReview_extra u-grid u-grid-gap-medium g-inner-spacing-medium o-border-thin-top g-border-gray30 c-siteReview_extra-user"><!----> <div class="c-siteReview_externalLink g-color-gray80 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter c-siteReview_flag"><svg class="g-outer-spacing-right-small"><use xlink:href="#flag"></use></svg> <span class="g-text-link u-text-underline-under u-text-uppercase">Report</span></div> <!----> <div class="c-siteReview_platform g-text-bold g-color-gray80 g-text-xsmall u-text-right u-text-uppercase">
      Xbox Series X
    </div></div></div> <!----> <!----></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 10 out of 10" aria-label="User score 10 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_green c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-gray90 c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">10</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/HakkaNoTogame/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="HakkaNoTogame">
    HakkaNoTogame
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Mar 8, 2022
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>This game is a 10 if there ever was one. The world building is absolutely top notch. The secrets have secrets. I wouldn't say this game is 100% new player friendly, but it is more so than other FromSoft titles. The way you have to dig for the story.. the combat.. finding secrets.. finally defeating that boss you've been stuck on is the most rewarding and addicting loop in any game. This is hands-down a generation defining game. It is a perfect culmination of all the works FromSoftware has delivered to us. If you are a FromSoft fan this is an absolute must buy. If you are on the fence please give it a try. This game is more than worth the asking price with all the content on hand.

P.S. I am a fan of HFW too and I think the people who are picking a side between the two games need their head examined.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

None of these things have been an issue for me. Sure the graphics aren’t AAA level, but the art direction more than makes up for that. I haven’t entered a world that has more character to it since Skyrim. This game is brilliant, and is greater than the sum of its parts. Especially weird are the reviews saying “Forbidden West is better”??? This is not a flawless game, but it is still an amazing one. If you give it a chance and have the patience to learn from dying instead of getting angry, then please don’t let the negative user scores throw you off. If you can’t handle dying or don’t like overcoming adversity, then don’t play it. If you like all the aspects and areas of your open worlds thoroughly explained so that there is no mystery or discovery, then this game is not for you.       Xbox Series X
    </div></div></div> <!----> <!----></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 8 out of 10" aria-label="User score 8 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_green c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-gray90 c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">8</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/Viollet/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="Viollet">
    Viollet
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Mar 7, 2022
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>I am writing this as a person who has finished the game and done all side quests:
A good game with a high difficulty, although it has the same dark souls format he open world gives it a new feel however i can't help but to think that they couldn't make enough bosses and just ended up re using a lot of their bosses sometimes up to 5 times. The dungeons are fairly boring but necessary to progress a certain npc's quest line which you will want to do considering he gives you incantations(a form of spell). Despite the few crashes i have had it still runs really good, and as for the story the game follows dark souls usual cryptic path of giving you small bits and pieces that you yourself has to piece together. Although the horse is helpful it can be annoying to use because it's not exactly smooth and I have had a bit of an issue with getting of the horse because sometimes the game does not let you and other times you get stuck mid air and die. They do re use a few enemies and concepts from previous dark souls games like the crab, it's really up to you to decide if this is a nice callback/hint to the previous games or if its lazy. The npc's with decently long quest lines are fewer then i originally expected and with bad rewards at the end of there quests however that is my personal opinion, the weapons in this game are very different and a meta has already established in both in pve and pvp. in pve you can just spam scarlet rot on almost every single boss trivializing the game or just use magic because it does way to much damage. In pvp you want to power stance with fast weapons, use a heavy shield and armor or use the blood hounds curved great sword and spam the weapon art. This was my only negative experiences with the game, if all of this sounds fine to you i would highly suggest buying it even at full price</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">
        Read More

People complaing about graphics generaly dont know what bad graphics are because they are from this generation of hardware. The difficulty is what makes these games if you cant start like everyone else at the start of the game go do something else. This game is based on your skill as a player if you find a stratagy that works you win if you dont you die. I said this before game developers need to add an acheivment of I bought that or I earned that. You get a Trophe by beating the game on a base difficulty that ships with game or you can buy the trophe for a doller and yhey give you a game breaking weapon. The point is you ether have the skill to win or admit you cant do it and have a mark that shows it. If your not haveing fun why are you playing after you desided the game isnt to your taste? That doesnt make a game bad it means you didnt enjoy it. I saw a 0 review on here saying that the deves promised the game would have there language avalable. I understand this persons review. I have 100+ hrs into it and still haven’t seen and done everything and not once got bored or tired of it. This is basically what I call an open open world game. It doesn’t hold your hand and tell you how great you are. You earn your way through it every step and it takes a lot of what made Zelda/Skyrim great and puts some Dark Souls into them. It’s utterly brilliant and the themes and art are incredible. If this was the last game I ever played I’d be at peace with it. Best $ I ever spent on anything in last decade. Only drawbacks are fact it’s not a showboat title for graphics and it’s tough until you figure it out.     Mar 7, 2022
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>Best game FROM SOFTWARE has put out to date! GOTY Material.
Elden Ring is like a good wine gets better with time, not too much time but it does take a bit to get used too as it breaks the mold on what a modern day Open World RPG can be. it does not take your hand and tell you what to do. It lets you mess up and realize your suddenly in front of a HUGE DRAGON. It lets you feel scared and humbled when you open the wrong chest and teleports you to a place far away that your not even close to level. And yes, it frustrates you like FROM Software games do... You will call it the b... you will damn your game counsel, but when you are able to beat a boss, the sense of accomplishment cannot be beat.     ThatHobknocker
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Mar 7, 2022
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>Elden Ring is all of FromSoftware's experience combined into one game with a vast open world to boot. Most open world games while huge are empty, Elden Ring's world is not. It's bright, lively, and enchanting while also being dark, gritty, and terrifying. It becons the player to go out and explore regardless of what challenges may be around each corner. The combat is a deep and intense as ever, with plenty of options for the player to explore and tailor their playstyle. And as always the boss's are as difficult as ever with some boardering on the insane. The sheer creativety of the monstrosities that have been created are jaw-dropping. Thankfully you do not have to face these challenges alone with the online co-op and the new spirit summoning system to ease your troubles on this long journey. The story is interesing but elusive which will require multiple playthroughs to fully squeze the blood from this stone, giving the game even more replay value. I highly recommend giving this game a shot but understand that while it is the most accessible FromSoftware title it is a challenge. You will die. A lot.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Mar 7, 2022
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>I’m happy others like it.  I love the imagination and graphics.  I paid for the game day one after critics review.  Sadly I played 10 hours or so and I’m done.  It’s too slow.  It doesn’t feel like you are making any progress.  The UI looks like it belongs in a $1 bin game store 1990’s indy games.  Only progress I could make is stealth play.  To me that is boring.

Again, I’m probably an average or below average player.  I own that.  I heard Elden Ring was more approachable of Dark Souls game.  It may be but apparently I am not even that good.

My recommendation unless you are a top 30% skilled gammer.  Save your money and play cyber punk or assassins creed.  Both of those games are amazing.  Elden Ring was a big waist of money for me.  It may run well, look good, but critics do not give enough warning on how unapproachable this game is for the vast majority of average skilled gamers.  Clearly the critic rating system for informing average gamer purchases is flawed.  Look at the user scores on these games from now on!</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

Sneaking throw forests and swamps, scratch plans ara abandoned to the intense curiosity that comes with discovering an unexpected ruin, spectral boatman, cave or castle. Razor-sharp combat mechanics reward perseverance and skill whilst punishing the impulsive with the swift admonishment of death. There is almost too much to do yet still, there are no dull moments. A masterpiece of game design and ingenuity. it is hard to see how anything can stop this from being GOTY.

  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>Not a terrible game. But failing of expectations. A boring open world with a repetitive loot table. As always Fromsoftware fails to fix its bugs and glitches.  World rendering, Weapon clipping and hitbox issues. However a majority of the bosses are fresh and fun and great. Some bosses are just lazy but other Dark  Souls games have had this issue. But this doesnt excuse them from repeating the mistake. I am aiming to give a fair review because I feel a ton of the reviews have been inflated and are not living in reality. The Lore falls short and flat compared to its siblings of Dark Souls and Bloodborne but makes up for it for the fresh attempt. I am writing it a 7 for the boring first few hours of the game. It really does pick up near the end of the game but it is not a masterpiece by any means. It is good, not great and not perfect.       Xbox Series X
    </div></div></div> <!----> <!----></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 5 out of 10" aria-label="User score 5 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_yellow c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-gray90 c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">5</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/Rainbow_Lotus/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="Rainbow_Lotus">
    Rainbow_Lotus
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Mar 6, 2022
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>This is my biggest video-game-disapointment ever.
A dark souls game of extreme quality, that has been opened for the casual gamer. That was my expectation. Now, 30 hours of later, im deinstalling, and am not going to ever play this, nor buy any From Software game ever again...

Honestly: I regret the 30 hours of frustration i had, and the hilarious amount i paid for it.
It basically is just a fighting simulator. There is nothing more in this game. Run around, fight difficult to impossible (for me) battles, grind endlessly, progress extremely slowly, and, from time to time, discover items that may or may not be useful for you.
You will die a lot, lose all character progress regulairly, and generally, have no idea what this game is actually about. The story is non-existent, the world is extremely lifeless, and just filled with enemies that wait only or you, and the storyline will come to an end pretty fast, because you will just not be able to beat the bosses. At least, if you are a casual gamer iike me.
Which forces you to battle easy opponents forever, as rewards and character developement are hardly more than a cosmetic feature.

Of course there are ways to exploit the game, but as soon as i need youtube in a tab to achieve any chance of progression, a game has failed for me.

My last experience in this game, after exploring the whole starting region desperately, was a sorceress who finally enabled me to learn new spells. Which gave me hope, that the torture had come to an end.
And guess what: Those spells are far weaker than the weak ones, that you start with. Its a slap in the face, and im sure, that its an intended one.
This is Elden Ring in a nutshell...</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">
        Read More
      </span> <!----> <!----></button></div> <!----></div></div> <div class="c-siteReview_extra u-grid u-grid-gap-medium g-inner-spacing-medium o-border-thin-top g-border-gray30 c-siteReview_extra-user"><!----> <div class="c-siteReview_externalLink g-color-gray80 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter c-siteReview_flag"><svg class="g-outer-spacing-right-small"><use xlink:href="#flag"></use></svg> <span class="g-text-link u-text-underline-under u-text-uppercase">Report</span></div> <!----> <div class="c-siteReview_platform g-text-bold g-color-gray80 g-text-xsmall u-text-right u-text-uppercase">
      Xbox Series X

  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>The game is fun but certainly not a 10 nor is it a 0. It adds nothing new to gaming that hasn’t been done elsewhere and typically done (much) better. Movement and combat certainly have improved compared to previous iterations of this game. The overall accessibility is still very bad, be it by design or incompetence. For example, the inventory is so clunky and dated. Key information on items stats is hidden, for a “core” game this should be easily accessible. Most of the game’s difficulty comes from obfuscation of the game’s mechanics, so you have to resort to online guides &amp; walkthroughs.
Nevertheless, I do have a lot of fun exploring and fighting but there remains a constant feeling this game could have been so much better.</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">

    </div></div></div> <!----> <!----></div><div><div class="c-siteReview g-bg-gray10 u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-large"><div class="c-siteReview_main g-inner-spacing-medium"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader c-siteReviewHeader-user u-grid g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium u-flexbox-alignCenter"><div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewScore"><a><div data-v-e408cafe="" class="c-siteReviewScore_background c-siteReviewScore_background-user"><div data-v-e408cafe="" title="User score 8 out of 10" aria-label="User score 8 out of 10" class="c-siteReviewScore u-flexbox-column u-flexbox-alignCenter u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-text-bold c-siteReviewScore_green c-siteReviewScore_user g-color-gray90 c-siteReviewScore_small"><span data-v-e408cafe="">8</span></div></div></a></div> <a href="/user/idbethrilled/" class="c-siteReviewHeader_username g-text-bold g-color-gray90 g-text-link u-text-underline-under" title="idbethrilled">
    idbethrilled
  </a> <div class="c-siteReviewHeader_reviewDate g-color-gray80 u-text-uppercase">
    Mar 5, 2022
  </div></div> <div><div class="c-siteReview_quote g-outer-spacing-bottom-medium"><span>Don't listen to the cult, be fully warry of the game you are about to buy. I have fully enjoyed the game but I'm about half way through and frankly, I'm burned out it's just too repetitive.

The Critics reviews for this game, are insane. Have they lost their **** minds? This game is the definition of quantity over quality.

Why is this game immune to basic critiques other games get ROASTED for? Its open **** bad. Pure and simple. It's big? it's open? But it's 2022 and EVERY open world has to be more than just open and big. The level design is crude and linear. Choice in design amounts to "path with traps" or "path with no traps". To much of dungeons is walking on basic rooftops with no level design whatsoever on them. It's lazy. They should have cut the game in half and focused. Dungeons and villages are copy-paste, traps are crude, there is just too much yet so little outside of the combat.

Which would be fine, if the game weren't acting like it was anything more than just combat.

I honestly do really enjoy this game's gameplay, but for ****'s pretty subpar as far as diversity of offerings and complexity of systems. I've gotten about 1/2 the way through (I've done most everything up to entering the Capital and I'm level 90ish) and I'm pretty much burned out. The story, frankly, is just lore...that's it. You've got 1 real story going on and the rest is just set dressing to explain gameplay choices that were already present in Dark ****, it's not story. There is nothing compelling here. It's just beautiful metaphorical imagery that amounts to pretty much nothing narratively other than a loose allegory for life that's so vague and lacking in substance that it's just boring. They stole the death rune? Neat...what does that mean? That we can revive...that's it. The entire plot is just telling you why you are playing a dark souls game.

At what point does "mysterious" end up just being "vague and empty"...because my experience has been thinking something was coming, and being disappointed OVER and OVER.

I don't want quest logs or map icons telling me where to go, but this game won't even give you enough story context to tell you the next step in a quest. They just give you a dagger and say "give it to the person who owns it"...like what the actual ???? It's like they forgot to finish the game. I have spent a vast swathe of time playing this game, doing nothing but looking up the next step because the game gave me NOTHING and I'm not gonna waste my time searching for a needle in a haystack.

I LOVE solving puzzles, I love piecing together information, I love open story **** favorite game of all time is Outer Wilds. This game, just frankly **** outside of the combat (which is still dated)...deeply. The horse controls are pretty mediocre and lack in clarity, bosses are all dodge spam and lack interesting mechanics (I can name like 3 bosses that actually felt neat but 1 of them was so bad at the same time I don't even want to mention him).

I am TOTALLY FINE with how hard this game **** anything it's the easiest dark souls ever. It's just only a dark souls game.

I do think, for a Souls gamer...this game is gunna be a ****'t hesitate. Buy it.

But for me, a person who has played this kind of game before...I'm just not interested in more of the same.

Being conservative, not pushing your game franchise to be more, that's not something that should be rewarded with the amount of praise this game is getting...there is SO MUCH this game franchise could do to bring out greater gameplay complexity while maintaining its unique stamp. Being open world isn't revolutionary. Not having basic UI elements isn't revolutionary. Telling a vague story badly isn't compelling. These are problems.

This game is deeply overhyped...period. But so are many games, such as BOTW...which was also great in many categories while mediocre in others. However, BOTW was actually innovative. It took risks. This game is a singleplayer MMO from 2004 with better combat. Thats how crude it feels to engage with the world and story and level design. That has to count for SOMETHING in the score.

So I'm sorry but I have to dock this ****'s not perfect, it lacks so much. In a RPG game market that is deeply more complex than this title I don't really see what it is doing so right that it warrants a ****'s just doing so little and pumping out a **** that's all games have to be now? That's just what AC is doing and everyone docks **** I like this more than **** how is this game dodging the basic criticism the industry applies to every other similar title?

Sifu and Hades has done more to move the Dark Souls formula forward than FromSoft ****'s bad. This isn't the next BOTW, this is just another Dark Souls title. Don't be deluded by the hype</span></div> <div class="c-globalButton g-outer-spacing-top-small c-globalButton-small c-globalButton-primary"><button class="c-globalButton_container g-text-normal g-height-100 u-flexbox u-flexbox-alignCenter u-pointer u-flexbox-justifyCenter g-width-fit-content"><span class="c-globalButton_label">
